0.title: 3 accused in Chandigarh University video leak case sent to 7-day police remand
0.article_body: A court in Punjab's Mohali sent the three accused arrested over the alleged leak of videos of girls at Chandigarh University to seven-day police remand. Police have arrested the accused woman, but said she only sent her own video to her boyfriend in Shimla, who was also arrested on Sunday. Another man was arrested from Himachal Pradesh in this case.

1.title: Mob vandalises temple & removes saffron flag in UK, India condemns incident
1.article_body: The Indian High Commission in the UK has 'strongly condemned' the incident wherein a temple was vandalised by a mob in Leicester and a saffron flag erected there was removed. "We've strongly taken up this matter with the UK authorities and...sought immediate action against those involved in the attack," it said. Videos showing the attack have gone viral on Twitter.

2.title: Raj BJP MLA brings a cow to Vidhan Sabha over spread of lumpy skin disease
2.article_body: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Pushkar, Suresh Singh Rawat, brought a cow to the state's Assembly premises on Monday to draw attention towards the spread of lumpy skin disease. Cows are suffering but the state government is in a deep slumber, Rawat said. The cow later went out of control due to excessive noise while Rawat talked to reporters.

3.title: Dropouts-turned-founders like Kamath are exceptionally brilliant people: Ashneer
3.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover said college dropouts who went on to start their own companies, like Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath, are "exceptionally brilliant people". "[Those dropouts] felt like the formal education process is a waste of their time. They felt they can learn quicker than that education process. And those people have gone and built exceptional businesses," Grover added.

4.title: James promised acting won't be overshadowed by technology in Avatar: Sam
4.article_body: Actor Sam Worthington revealed that director James Cameron promised him that his acting in 'Avatar' will not be overshadowed by technology. "It was the truth. And that was the promise that he made me, and that's what came out...It was just there. And that's the essence that I saw," Sam added. Sam will feature in 'Avatar: The Way of Water'.

5.title: Yati Narsinghanand, 2 others booked for hate speech in UP's Aligarh
5.article_body: Yati Narsinghanand, head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, along with two others, have been booked for allegedly making inflammatory statements against a particular community, police said on Monday. The accused, including an Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha functionary and her husband, allegedly made the statements during a religious programme held in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Sunday night.

6.title: ED files chargesheet against Partha, his aide in recruitment scam
6.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday submitted a chargesheet before a special court against former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam. They both were arrested by the ED on July 23. As per the chargesheet, there are 43 witnesses in the case.

7.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
7.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Heavy rainfall is very likely over parts of Assam, Meghalaya and Madhya Pradesh till September 23. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha till September 21 and over Arunachal Pradesh on September 22 and 23. Andhra Pradesh and Telangana may witness heavy rainfall till September 21.

8.title: Gangster with 25 criminal cases shot dead outside court in Rajasthan
8.article_body: A gangster was shot dead by four-five unidentified assailants outside a court in Rajasthan's Nagaur when he was about to appear before the court on Monday. The gangster, Sandeep Sethi, came out of jail on bail last week. He had 25 criminal cases registered against him, a police officer said. The accused came on bikes and fired 9-10 rounds.

9.title: Man dies in Thane's Ulhasnagar after adjacent building's wall falls on him
9.article_body: A 60-year-old man was killed and his 58-year-old wife injured in Thane district's Ulhasnagar after a slab of a wall from an adjacent building collapsed on their roof on Sunday. The man, who recently celebrated his 38th wedding anniversary, was still in bed when the wall came falling through the roof. Municipal authorities said they'd recommended repairs to the building.

10.title: King Charles leaves a note on his mother Queen Elizabeth's coffin
10.article_body: King Charles III left a handwritten note on his mother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral at the Westminster Abbey, which read, "In loving and devoted memory. Charles R". The "R" in King Charles' title refers to "Rex," which means king in Latin. The wreath on the coffin included flowers cut from Buckingham Palace, Clarence House and Highgrove House.

11.title: Missed 'Dil Chahta Hai': Isha Koppikar on her biggest mistake in B'wood
11.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar, when asked to share the biggest mistake she made in her Bollywood career, said that she "missed" Aamir Khan, Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna-starrer 'Dil Chahta Hai'. She revealed that she was offered the role opposite Saif, which was eventually played by Sonali Kulkarni. "I [already] gave my dates to Pyaar Ishq Aur Mohabbat," said Isha.

12.title: Told Shoaib Malik to retire; knew that he'll not be respected: Hafeez
12.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Mohammad Hafeez said that all-rounder Shoaib Malik "gave his best" to the country for "about 21-22 years". "When I took my retirement, I told Malik to take retirement as well because I knew that he will not be respected," Hafeez said. Notably, 40-year-old Malik was overlooked by the selectors for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia.

13.title: Federer arrives in London for his final ATP tournament Laver Cup
13.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has arrived in London for his final ATP tournament, the Laver Cup. The 41-year-old recently announced that he will retire after the Laver Cup, scheduled to be held from September 23 to 25. Federer will play for Team Europe, which includes Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray, among others.

14.title: Mumbai Police ban cattle transportation stating lumpy skin disease
14.article_body: The Mumbai Police has prohibited the transportation of cattle in the city to prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease. Officials said the order, which came into effect on September 14, will remain in force till October 13. Other than cattle, transportation of fodder, grass or equipment which came in contact with lumpy skin disease-affected animals is also prohibited.

15.title: FTX may be operating in UK without authorisation: Britain's financial watchdog
15.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX may be offering financial services or products in the United Kingdom  without authorisation, Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Friday. "This firm is not authorised by us and is targeting people in the UK," FCA said in a statement titled 'FTX'. Global rules are needed to regulate international crypto firms, FCA had said earlier.

16.title: Ghana declares end of Marburg virus outbreak
16.article_body: Ghanaian health authorities have declared the end of the recent Marburg virus outbreak that claimed three lives, Ghana's presidency informed on Monday. The outbreak of the highly infectious disease, which is similar to Ebola, was confirmed in July. This was the second Marburg virus outbreak in West Africa, following an outbreak in Guinea last year.

17.title: Told Ayan 'Won't do Brahmastra if it doesn't work for me': Nagarjuna
17.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna revealed filmmaker Ayan Mukerji offered him 'Brahmastra' in 2018. "When I was told Ayan wants me to play a role in his film, I said sure, but what am I going to be doing in a film like that? And I won't do it if it doesn't work for me," he stated. Nagarjuna played Anish Shetty in 'Brahmastra'.

18.title: I get things that are more 'maaro-todo', want something new: Sunny
18.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol, speaking about his image, said, "I wish they (filmmakers) would give me an opportunity to do something more than just scream." "I always want something new...but zyadatar (mostly) because of the commercial element, I get things that are more maaro-todo (hit and break)," he added. Sunny will be next seen in films like 'Chup' and 'Gadar 2'.

19.title: StartupXseed Ventures' Fund II closes at ₹243 crore
19.article_body: The second fund of early-stage venture capital firm StartupXseed Ventures was closed at ₹243 crore, oversubscribed by 20% compared to its initial target. StartupXseed was founded by BV Naidu (Former Director STPI) along with Mohandas Pai (through Aarin Capital), Ramakrishna V and Ravi Thakur. Fund II will invest between ₹5 - ₹12 crore in enterprise SaaS and deeptech startups.

20.title: Kidnappers pose as police to extort ₹11 lakh from B'luru real estate brokers
20.article_body: Five people allegedly kidnapped two real estate brokers from near the satellite bus stand on Mysuru Road in Bengaluru after posing as Telangana Police officers and extorted ₹11 lakh from them. The Bengaluru Police has arrested the accused. They kept the duo in a hotel room and asked for ₹50 lakh for letting them go.

21.title: 14-yr-old ends life after 'feeling rejected by female friend' in Mumbai
21.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 10 student died by suicide in Mumbai on Friday night after he felt rejected by a female friend, police said. The boy had chatted with a female friend who told him that they were just friends and that triggered the alleged suicide, Indian Express quoted police sources as saying. Police have registered a case of accidental death.

22.title: Can't rule out possibility of nuclear deal talks on UNGA sidelines: Iran
22.article_body: A meeting regarding the 2015 nuclear deal on the sidelines of this year's UN General Assembly is not entirely out of question, Iran's Foreign Ministry said on Monday. Tehran, however, dismissed the possibility of a bilateral meeting between Iranian and US officials. Iran is demanding the closure of an IAEA probe as a precondition for the pact's revival.

23.title: Pune city reports 39 cases of Swine Flu, 1 death in 7 days: Data
23.article_body: Pune Health Department has said the city has reported 39 cases of Swine Flu and one death due to the virus in the seven days between September 10-17. Dr Prachee Sathe from Ruby Hall Clinic said there're patients from all age groups who're admitted due to the disease. Pune has reported 909 Swine Flu cases and 40 deaths this year.

24.title: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joins BJP
24.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh joined the Bharatiya Janata Party on Monday and merged his party, Punjab Lok Congress(PLC), with the BJP. Singh had floated Punjab Lok Congress after he had quit the Indian National Congress in 2021. He had earlier met BJP National President JP Nadda in Delhi.

25.title: Even if 'RRR' wins Oscar, won't change the way I work: SS Rajamouli
25.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli said his plans for his next film won't change even if he wins an Oscar for 'RRR' or not. "Oscar will be a real boost for morale for the (film's) unit...the country itself, but that's not going to change the way I work," he added. Rajamouli stated he wants to constantly keep upgrading himself as a filmmaker.

26.title: Ponting used to hit balls at 160 kmph speed with a cap on: Lee
26.article_body: Ex-Australian pacer Brett Lee narrated a 1994-95 incident about former skipper Ricky Ponting. "We had to face 12 balls at a 160 kmph off the bowling machine in the...nets," Lee said. "Well, the rumour is that...Ponting went there...with a cap on. Rod Marsh said 'what are you doing?' He said 'I'm batting'...Ponting goes bang...did not miss one," he added.

27.title: Yuvraj watches his 6 sixes in an over with son to mark 15th anniversary, shares video
27.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself and his seven-month-old son Orion watching his six sixes in an over. "Couldn’t have found a better partner to watch this together with after 15 years," Yuvraj wrote. Yuvraj slammed six sixes in an over off England's Stuart Broad in T20 World Cup on September 19, 2007.

28.title: Bombay HC denies bail to professor Hany Babu in Elgar Parishad case
28.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected the regular bail application of Delhi University professor and Elgar Parishad accused Hany Babu. Arrested in July 2020 from his home in Delhi, he is currently lodged in Mumbai's Taloja jail. The National Investigation Agency has accused Babu of a conspiracy to kill PM Narendra Modi, stating a letter was found on his computer.

29.title: Satellite spectrum auction will hinder rural broadband connectivity: Industry body chief
29.article_body: Telecom industry body ITU-APT Foundation of India (IAFI) President Bharat Bhatia said auctioning satellite spectrum will hinder growth of rural broadband connectivity in India. "If one operator buys [satellite spectrum], no one else can access and the satellite industry will not grow," Bhatia added. Allocating spectrum administratively rather than via auction is a better option, he further said.

30.title: Smart LED streetlights to be installed in every corner of Bengaluru
30.article_body: Bengaluru will see smart LED streetlights that are expected to reduce energy wastage as all sodium vapour lamps will be removed from the city streets. Eight zones will get the upgraded streetlights in another two months, officials said. As many as 4.85 lakh sodium vapour lamps will be replaced with LED lights.

31.title: We ran an experiment: YouTube after users claim watching 10 unskippable ads
31.article_body: A couple of months after some users claimed to see 10 unskippable advertisements during a single break, YouTube in a statement to 9to5Google confirmed that it ran a small experiment globally. YouTube said that it "served multiple ads in an ad pod when viewers watched longer videos on connected TVs". "We have concluded this small experiment," the company added.

32.title: Ranbir, Alia meet family of their bodyguard, latter calls it 'Family Astra'
32.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt recently met the family of their security consultant Yusuf Ibrahim. He took to his Instagram Stories to share photos of Alia and Ranbir as they posed with his family. Along with a photo, Yusuf wrote 'FamilyAstra' in reference to the couple's film 'Brahmastra', which was released on September 9.

33.title: SEBI invites EoIs for implementing new tool to boost social media surveillance
33.article_body: SEBI has invited expressions of interest (EoIs) to implement a 'Web Intelligence Tool' to boost surveillance of social media and other platforms. Publicly available data, a result of rising internet usage, has the potential to provide insights on topics related to various securities laws' violations, SEBI said. The tool should save time and gather unstructured, publicly available data, SEBI added.

34.title: Pimpri Chinchwad-based IT professional robbed, beaten up by 2 men
34.article_body: A 47-year-old Pimpri-Chinchwad-based IT professional was waylaid and robbed by two men on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway, police said. The victim was returning home when the accused started arguing with him, robbed him and beat him up. They hatched a fake accident plan and pretended that their mobile was broken in the incident, hence threatening and extorting money from the victim.

35.title: Delhi sees rise in dengue cases, reports 101 new infections last week
35.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 101 people were diagnosed with the infection in the last week alone. Delhi has reported 152 dengue cases so far in September, taking the national capital's total tally to nearly 400 so far this year, a report said. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

36.title: Kohli changed the focus of Team India when he became captain: Johnson
36.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Mitchell Johnson said that batter Virat Kohli changed the focus of the Indian team when he took on the captaincy. Kohli was named as India's all-format captain in 2017. Rohit Sharma replaced Kohli as limited-overs captain in December last year and as full-time Test captain in February this year.

37.title: 9 persons sentenced to life imprisonment in 11-yr-old Rohtak murder case
37.article_body: A local court in Haryana's Rohtak sentenced nine persons to life imprisonment in an 11-year-old murder case. They were convicted of killing a man, a resident of Rohtak and the court also fined each convict ₹20,000. On August 2, 2011, the man was killed with sticks and bricks, Sampla Police Station in-charge Rakesh Saini said.

38.title: Roma coach Jose Mourinho restrained, sent off after charging at referee
38.article_body: AS Roma manager Jose Mourinho was sent off during his team's match against Atalanta after he invaded the pitch to confront the referee. Mourinho had to be restrained by his own coaching staff and Serie A officials after Roma was not awarded a penalty. In February 2022, Mourinho was banned for two games after he acted in a "threatening" manner.

39.title: SEBI seeks details of PE, VC funds with 5 or less investors: Report
39.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked venture capital (VC) and private equity (PE) funds with five or fewer investors to disclose certain details, The Economic Times reported. This includes the investors' names, amount committed and funds raised. The market regulator also requested for details of investee companies, their countries of origin and nature of their business.

40.title: Tharoor meets Sonia Gandhi after endorsing 'constructive reforms' petition
40.article_body: Hours after endorsing a petition by younger members of the party seeking 'constructive reforms' in the Congress, MP Shashi Tharoor met UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi in Delhi today. "I welcome this petition that is being circulated by a group of young Congress members...It has gathered over 650 signatures so far. I am happy to endorse it," he said.

41.title: India gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia: Report
41.article_body: India reportedly gained ₹35,000 crore by importing discounted crude oil from Russia since the Ukraine conflict began in February. As per a report, India has emerged as the second-largest buyer of Russian oil after China. Russian oil accounts for 12% of the country's total oil purchase as compared to less than 1% before the war.

42.title: When a film premieres at TIFF, it's also taken seriously in India: Radhika
42.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan, who recently attended the premiere of her film 'Kacchey Limbu' at Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF), said that when a film is premiered on a platform like TIFF, it is also taken seriously in India. "It is not just another film," she added. Radhika further said 'Kacchey Limbu' addresses a very important topic.

43.title: Gambhir urges Indians to end hero worship, says 'Don't create monsters in dressing room'
43.article_body: Gautam Gambhir has urged Indians to end hero worship in cricket. "Don't create monsters in dressing room," he said. Gambhir noted when Virat Kohli slammed his 71st international hundred, Indians ignored Bhuvneshwar Kumar's five-wicket contribution in that match. He stated only Kapil Dev and MS Dhoni are credited for India's World Cup victories, adding, "We never bother about small contributions."

44.title: I'm a Balki fan now, 'Chup' is his best film: Mahesh Bhatt
44.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt shared Mahesh Bhatt's review of her upcoming film 'Chup'. As per the post, Mahesh Bhatt called 'Chup' a film that "has audacity and stands tall all alone". She mentioned that the filmmaker is now a fan of R Balki and called 'Chup' "his best film". The R Balki directorial also stars Sunny Deol and Dulquer Salmaan.

45.title: 71 international tons, that's ridiculous: Finch on Kohli ahead of 1st T20I
45.article_body: Ahead of India-Australia first T20I, Australia skipper Aaron Finch said it'll take a very brave man to write India batter Virat Kohli off. "At any stage, he has shown for 15 years now that he's one of the greatest players of all time...He's super and has 71 international centuries. That's just ridiculous," he added. Match will be played on Tuesday.

46.title: J&K Congress set to pass resolution to appoint Rahul as party President
46.article_body: Ahead of the party's presidential election, the J&K Pradesh Congress Committee is set to pass a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as party chief again. The Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu and Bihar units of the party have already passed the resolutions backing the Wayanad MP. The election for the crucial post will be held on October 17.

47.title: Repair 221 potholes on major roads within 10 days: HC to BBMP
47.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has been ordered by the Karnataka HC to repair 221 potholes on major roads within 10 days. The HC noted that citizens have a right to have roads without potholes and BBMP is obliged to provide better roads. BBMP also informed the HC that it has removed 2,024 out of 2,626 encroachments on stormwater drains.

48.title: Man loses 8 fingers during machine work in Gurugram, says 'Had no training'
48.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly lost eight fingers of his hands while working on a power press machine in Gurugram. He said that he had told the supervisor that he did not know how to operate the machine. "I...had no training in how to operate the machine...The supervisor said...there was shortage of operators and threatened to fire me," the victim added.

49.title: Mitchell Johnson encounters snake in his hotel room in Lucknow, shares pics
49.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson, who is currently in India for the Legends League Cricket 2022, took to Instagram to reveal that he encountered a snake in his hotel room in Lucknow. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "Anyone know what type of snake this is?" In another post, he wrote, "Interesting stay so far in Lucknow."

50.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann deplaned in Germany for being drunk, claim reports; AAP denies
50.article_body: After reports claimed that Punjab's Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann was deplaned at Frankfurt airport on Saturday night because he was drunk, the Aam Aadmi Party has denied these allegations. "The dirty tricks department of our political opponents are spreading these canards to defame our CM," AAP said. Other reports said that Mann skipped his scheduled flight as he was unwell.

51.title: OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal's salary rises 250% to ₹5.6 crore in FY22
51.article_body: Ritesh Agarwal, Founder and Group CEO of OYO, received a remuneration of ₹5.6 crore in FY22, up 250% from ₹1.6 crore in the previous year. Notably, the 28-year-old's compensation stood at ₹21.5 lakh in FY20. In a filing with SEBI, OYO said its ESOP expenses rose 344% to ₹680 crore in FY22, while salary and bonus expenses fell by 27%.

52.title: Planning to shoot part 2 and 3 together: Ranbir Kapoor on ‘Brahmastra’
52.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said the makers of 'Brahmastra' are planning to shoot the remaining parts of the film's trilogy together. "Our plan as a team is to shoot both part 2 and part 3 together so that we don't delay the films and they can be out in theatres as per the schedule," he said. 'Brahmastra' is directed by Ayan Mukerji.

53.title: It has to be a visual spectacle: Nagarjuna on his 100th film
53.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna said his 100th career film has to be a visual spectacle to bring people to theatres. "Doesn't have to be a 'Brahmastra' or VFX (heavy film), but larger than life is what I feel is bringing people to the theatres in big numbers," he added. Nagarjuna revealed that his 100th film is being written by four filmmakers.

54.title: Judicial custody of Sanjay Raut extended by 14 days in Patra Chawl case
54.article_body: A special PMLA court extended Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s judicial custody by 14 days in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The court will hear his bail petition on September 21. He was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore land scam case.

55.title: Pune Police arrest 19-yr-old boy, detain minor accomplice for arson
55.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 19-year-old boy and detained his minor accomplice for allegedly setting fire to four bikes and two cars in the parking lot of a residential building. Officials said that the suspects had a dispute with the residents during the Ganesh festival over the contribution to the celebrations. An FIR was registered at Sinhagad Road Police Station.

56.title: Ready for talks on prisoner swap but US not complying: Russia
56.article_body: Russian Foreign Ministry said that it is ready for talks on a prisoner exchange to release US citizens jailed in Russia, but the American embassy in Moscow is "not fulfilling its official duties" to maintain dialogue. The prison exchange could include US Marine Corps veteran Paul Whelan, basketball player Brittney Griner and Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

57.title: Before Aishwarya, wanted to cast Rekha in 'Ponniyin Selvan’: Mani Ratnam
57.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam has said he wanted to cast actress Rekha for the role of Nandini in his film 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One'. The role eventually went to Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. "Before Aishwarya, I wanted to work with Rekha for the same character. Didn't have any other actors in mind for this role," the director said at an event.

58.title: Cat population rises in Mumbai, BMC allocates ₹1 cr for sterilisation
58.article_body: The population of cats is on rise in several parts of Mumbai and the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to control the birth of cats by sterilising them. The civic body has allocated ₹1 crore for sterilisation project and urged NGOs to help them. "We are getting lots of complaints from citizens regarding cat menace," a BMC official said.

59.title: Cong's DK Shivakumar appears before ED in Delhi in money laundering case
59.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Monday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in Delhi for questioning in a money laundering case. Earlier, party leader Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Narendra Modi, alleging that it was part of his tactics to derail the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "But he won't succeed," Jairam had tweeted.

60.title: Amarinder Singh's decision to join BJP won't be appreciated by people: Cong MP
60.article_body: Ahead of Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder Singh joining BJP, Congress MP Deepender Hooda on Monday said, "I believe this is a wrong decision taken by…Singh." Furthermore, he said, "Right after the farmers' protest, his decision of joining the BJP will not be appreciated by the people...There is no conflict among the leaders of the Haryana Congress."

61.title: TSRTC starts bus service from Hitech City to Hyderabad Airport
61.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) announced a bus service from Shilparamam at HITECH City to Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The bus will be leaving Shilparamam every 30 minutes between 4:30 am and 10:30 pm daily. As per TSRTC's release, a 10 per cent discount will be provided for those who commute every day on the route.

62.title: 32-year-old graphic designer dies by suicide in Pune
62.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who worked as a graphic designer, has died by suicide in Pune. The victim, a resident of Raikar Mala, Dhayari, lived with his girlfriend but was alone at the time of the incident. Shailesh Sankhe, senior police inspector at Sinhagad, said that initial findings stated it was a case of suicide, but all angles are being probed.

63.title: 2 killed as typhoon Nanmadol hits Japan, PM delays departure to NY
63.article_body: At least two people were killed, 87 were injured and one went missing as typhoon Nanmadol triggered winds and record rainfall in western Japan on Monday leading to transport disruption. According to the trade ministry, about 3,40,000 households in Kyushu were without electricity. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida delayed his departure to New York to attend the UN General Assembly.

64.title: Uttarakhand man swept away while trying to cross swollen river; video surfaces
64.article_body: A video has surfaced online that shows a man being washed away while trying to cross a heavy flowing river in Uttarakhand's Fatehpur area. The man is missing and a search operation is currently underway. The video shows the man attempting to cross the river on foot, while some people were standing on the road.

65.title: No skin-to-skin contact with foreigners: Chinese official to locals over monkeypox
65.article_body: A top Chinese health official told locals, "To prevent possible monkeypox infection and as part of our healthy lifestyle, it is recommended that you do not have direct skin-to-skin contact with foreigners." The advice comes after the first known case of monkeypox in mainland China was reported. The monkeypox case was reported in an individual who arrived from abroad.

66.title: 14-yr-old boy who went missing tells Delhi Police, 'I was going to meet PM'
66.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, who went missing in Delhi, told police on being found that he was going to meet PM Narendra Modi. When police tried to enquire from him, he couldn't tell about his parents and address. Police later traced out his parents and handed him over to them. The boy's father said that he was having an unsound mind.

67.title: 1 arrested for cow slaughter after shootout in Greater Noida
67.article_body: Following a late-night exchange of fire with police personnel in Fatehpur Atta village of Greater Noida, one person was arrested for alleged cow slaughter. According to the police, remains of a cow and a country-made pistol with a live cartridge, among others, have been recovered. The three other associates of the accused, Taju, managed to run away, police said.

68.title: DotPe raises $58 million in Series B round led by Temasek
68.article_body: DotPe, an offline-to-online commerce platform for businesses, has raised $58 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Temasek and saw participation from existing investors PayU and InfoEdge Ventures, along with new investors Mitsubishi and Naya Capital. DotPe was founded in 2020 by former PayU executives Shailaz Nag, Gyanesh Sharma and Anurag Gupta.

69.title: 50 people sentenced to death by Gujarat trial courts in 8 months of 2022
69.article_body: Gujarat trial courts have sentenced 50 people to death in eight months of 2022. In February 2022, a special court had sentenced 38 convicts to death in connection with the 2008 Ahmedabad serial blast case. Trial courts also sentenced convicts to death in cases of rape and murder of minors, reports said.

70.title: Gaza farmer finds Byzantine era mosaic while trying to plant trees
70.article_body: A Palestinian farmer in Gaza discovered a mosaic from the Byzantine era while he was trying to plant more trees on his land. The farmer called the discovery a "treasure" and said, "It belongs to every Palestinian." The mosaic panels of the flooring depict animals and other features of social life during Byzantine era, Palestine's Tourism and Antiquities Ministry said.

71.title: Around 6 lakh consumers opt for power subsidy in Delhi in first 3 days
71.article_body: The Delhi government's official data shows that around six lakh electricity consumers have applied for electricity subsidy scheme in the first three days. As per the new policy, the automatic subsidy on electricity consumed up to 200 and 400 units will end from October 1 and only those who opt for it by September end will be eligible for subsidy.

72.title: China lodges 'stern representations' over Biden's Taiwan remark
72.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry on Monday lodged "stern representations" over US President Joe Biden saying that the US forces will defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion. The ministry's spokesperson said that China reserves the right to take action against activities that split the nation and urged the US to not send "wrong signals" to Taiwan independence separatist forces.

73.title: My 'Player of the Match' award is dedicated to Jhulan: Smriti on 1st ODI win
73.article_body: After India Women's seven-wicket win against England Women in first ODI, India opener Smriti Mandhana dedicated her 'Player of the Match' award to teammate Jhulan Goswami, who'll be retiring from international cricket after the ongoing series. "The way she bowled was amazing. Whatever the Indian team is gonna do in this series will be for Jhulu di [Jhulan]," she added.

74.title: BJP showed a malicious attitude towards the Opposition: Mayawati
74.article_body: BSP President Mayawati criticised the BJP for branding the Opposition as "jobless" and said that the party showed a malicious attitude towards the Opposition. "BJP’s claim that the Opposition is unemployed exposes their arrogant thinking and irresponsible attitude. The thinking of the government should be to prove honesty and loyalty towards the public interest and public welfare," said Mayawati.

75.title: AAP govt in Punjab to conduct floor test on Sept 22 amid 'Operation Lotus' claims
75.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has called a special Assembly session on September 22 to seek a trust vote amid AAP MLAs' claims of 'Operation Lotus' in the state. Last week, state Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema alleged that BJP contacted some 7 to 10 of its MLAs. He added BJP offered them up to ₹25 crore each to switch sides.

76.title: Pic of Anil Kapoor's American lookalike John Effer goes viral
76.article_body: A picture of John Effer, an American bodybuilder, has gone viral, with several social media users calling him Anil Kapoor's lookalike. Effer also shared a picture of himself alongside Anil's photograph on Instagram, writing, "I am waiting on that Bollywood call to be honest." "I literally thought you were Anil Kapoor," an Instagram user wrote. "Swole-nil Kapoor," another user joked.

77.title: Horses leading Queen's procession in London trained to hear 'sobbing' sounds
77.article_body: The horses leading Queen Elizabeth's coffin procession on Monday have undergone special training wherein crying soldiers threw flowers at them during rehearsals in order to make them familiar with the sound of 'sobbing'. The four horses chosen to lead the procession will guide a total of 199 military equines and were gifted to her by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

78.title: I did 80 auditions before I hacked my first ad: Actress Nimrat Kaur
78.article_body: Nimrat Kaur, speaking about her beginning days as an actress, said, "I did 80 auditions before I hacked my first advertisement...that is a lot of heartbreak." The actress revealed that she was set to feature alongside a top star in a film, however, the film was shelved. "I don't know if it's happening ever...it really broke my heart," she added.

79.title: ED has summoned Delhi AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak: Manish Sisodia
79.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday claimed that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned AAP MLA Durgesh Pathak in connection with its probe into the excise policy scam. "What does our MCD poll in-charge have to do with the Delhi government's excise policy? Is their target liquor policy or MCD polls?" Sisodia said in a tweet.

80.title: Russia may have lost 4 combat jets in Ukraine in last 10 days: UK
80.article_body: The British Defence Ministry has said it is likely that Russia lost at least four combat jets in Ukraine within the last 10 days, taking its attrition to approximately 55 since the invasion began. The UK military added that losses are possibly result of Russian Air Force attempting to provide air support to ground forces under pressure from Ukraine's advances.

81.title: World's highest battlefield Siachen Glacier gets satellite-based internet service
81.article_body: The Indian Army's Fire and Fury Corps took to Twitter to announce that Siachen Signallers activated satellite-based internet service on the the world's highest battlefield, Siachen Glacier, at a height of 19,061 feet. The internet is being provided by Bharat Broadband Network Limited (BBNL). The Fire and Fury Corps also tweeted pictures of the equipment being installed.

82.title: What flag and crown are on the Queen's coffin?
82.article_body: The coffin of Queen Elizabeth II has been draped by a flag called Royal Standard, which represents the Sovereign and the United Kingdom. It's split into four quarterings, with the colours red, yellow and blue. Each quartering represents a country in UK, excluding Wales. The crown lying atop Queen's coffin is Imperial State Crown, encrusted with more than 3,000 gemstones.

83.title: Russian 'torture chambers' found across Kharkiv region: Zelenskyy
83.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has claimed that over 10 "torture chambers" used by Russian forces to abuse detainees have been found across the Kharkiv region following Ukraine's recent retrieval of territory. Documents confirming the functioning of a so-called police force responsible for running one such "torture chamber" have been seized, Kharkiv's prosecutor's office said.

84.title: He shows sporting class again: Anurag on Bajrang's bronze at World C'ships
84.article_body: Congratulating Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia after his bronze medal win at World Wrestling Championships in Belgrade, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter and wrote, "Bajrang Punia shows his sporting class again!!" The 28-year-old Olympic bronze medallist became the first Indian to win four medals in the tournament. Bajrang beat Puerto Rico's Sebastian C Rivera 11-9 in 65-kg category.

85.title: Man gets violent, tries to break window of Pakistani flight mid-air; video surfaces
85.article_body: A video doing rounds on social media showed a violent male passenger arguing with the crew of a Peshawar-Dubai Pakistan International Airlines flight and trying to break one of its windows mid-air. The crew members alleged the man created a ruckus inside the airplane and lied down on the aisle. According to reports, the passenger was blacklisted by the airline.

86.title: 2 arrested for selling fake degrees, certificates in Noida
86.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested two suspects for allegedly making and selling fake degrees and certificates from Sector 58 area of Noida. The accused, Anand Shekhar and Chirag Sharma, used to run their illegal operations in Bengaluru before moving to Noida a few months ago, police said. The accused used to lure their victims with the help of Google advertisements.

87.title: Queen Elizabeth's state funeral begins at Westminster Abbey
87.article_body: Britain's longest-serving monarch Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral service has begun at Westminster Abbey in London. Prior to the funeral, a tenor bell at the abbey tolled 96 times, once for each year of the Queen's life. Notably, world leaders including President of India Droupadi Murmu, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron are attending the Queen's funeral.

88.title: Statue of Unity of no use, ₹3,000 cr should’ve been used for tribals: BTP leader
88.article_body: Gujarat's Bharatiya Tribal Party leader Chhotubhai Vasava said the Statue of Unity "has been of no use". On being asked, BJP has cited the Statue of Unity as one of its development projects in tribal areas for employment generation, Vasava said, "They spent ₹3,000 crore on the statue. They should have spent that money on development of tribal areas."

89.title: Gurugram civic body's enforcement team thrashed by multiple people
89.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram's enforcement team was allegedly attacked by unidentified suspects near the city's Mahavir Chowk. One official was thrashed by multiple people while another was hit by a stone, officials said. Notably, the incident happened when the enforcement team had gone to move about 40 illegal street vendors to a newly set up vending zone.

90.title: ‘Beyond The Star’ docu-series on Salman to release on his b'day: Report
90.article_body: 'Beyond The Star', the docu-series on Salman Khan, will reportedly release on December 27, which also happens to be the actor's birthday. As per reports, 'Beyond The Star' will see Salman's family, friends, co-stars and directors sharing their opinions on the actor. The docu-series, which is co-produced by Salman, will reportedly also show never-seen-before pictures and videos from his childhood.

91.title: Parts of B'luru to face power cuts on Sept 21 & 23 from 10 am-5 pm
91.article_body: Some parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts on September 21 and 23 between 10:00 am and 5:00 pm due to repair and maintenance work being undertaken by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). Areas like Veerabhadra Nagar, Hanumantha Nagar and Pramod Layout will be affected on September 21. Bairohalli, Ramohalli and Kengeri Town will be affected on September 23.

92.title: Cheetahs brought from Namibia 'cheerful' after first meal in India: Officials
92.article_body: The eight cheetahs brought to India from Nambia on Saturday had their first meal in India at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on Sunday evening and appeared cheerful and in good spirits, according to the park's officials. Each of the eight cheetahs was served two kilograms of buffalo meat. One of them ate less, but it's not concerning, officials added.

93.title: Eager to get house after dad's death, Delhi man kills brother with scissors
93.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his 21-year-old brother to death with a pair of scissors over property dispute in Delhi. The accused was upset after his father, who died of COVID-19, left his house in his wife's name. "He [accused] fought with his family...as he wanted it [house] to be registered under his name," police said.

94.title: Will use some of them: Ayan on fan theories around 'Brahmastra' trilogy
94.article_body: Celebrating Brahmastra's box office success, director Ayan Mukerji shared that the makers are "absorbing and learning" from audiences' feedback. He appreciated "amazing fan theories" around the upcoming films in the 'Brahmastra' trilogy and said he's "definitely going to use" some of them. Ayan also shared that he has started work on 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev & The Astraverse'.

95.title: Dhanush shares his look from 'Captain Miller', fans react
95.article_body: Dhanush took to Instagram to share a post revealing his look from the upcoming Tamil film 'Captain Miller'. Several fans reacted to his look with comments like "super", "can't wait" and "killing it". Arun Matheswaran, the filmmaker who is helming the film, also shared Dhanush's look on his Instagram Stories with the caption, "Killer Killer, Captain Miller!!"

96.title: Mumbai youth booked under Arms Act for cutting b'day cakes with sword
96.article_body: Police have booked a 17-year-old youth under Arms Act for cutting birthday cakes with a sword in Mumbai. A video of the act has gone viral on social media, showing the youth cutting at least 21 cakes with a sword in his hand, while his friends cheer for him during the party. Police said the video is from Borivali area.

97.title: Told bank I don't need loan anymore: Auto driver who won ₹25 cr lottery
97.article_body: An autorickshaw driver in Kerala, who won ₹25 crore lottery just a day after his application for ₹3 lakh loan (to go to Malaysia to work as a chef) was approved, said that he had told the bank that he doesn’t need the loan anymore. Lottery winner Anoop said that he will start something in the hotel field in Kerala.

98.title: ED attaches ₹48-cr assets belonging to ex-Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, his aide
98.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday attached assets worth ₹48 crore "beneficially owned" by former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection with the teacher recruitment scam. The attached properties include flats, a farmhouse and prime land in Kolkata. With this, the total attachment in the case stands at ₹103.10 crore.

99.title: Man burnt alive after truck catches fire in J&K's Kathua
99.article_body: A man burnt to death after the truck he was travelling in caught fire on Jammu-Pathankot national highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. The victim was the truck driver's helper and his identity is yet to be ascertained, police said. A fire tender reached the spot and controlled the fire, but it was too late to save the man.

100.title: Actress Kate Winslet rushed to hospital after slipping on her film set
100.article_body: Hollywood actress Kate Winslet was rushed to a hospital in Croatia after she slipped on the set of her film 'Lee', her representative said. "Kate...was taken to hospital as a precautionary measure required by the production. She is fine and will be filming, as planned, this week," the representative stated. The film is a biopic of Lee Miller, the model-turned-photographer.

101.title: 2 couples killed in accident after attending condolence meet in Rajasthan
101.article_body: Two couples travelling on a motorcycle and a scooty in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district were killed on Sunday when a car rammed into the vehicles from behind and overturned. The car driver left his vehicle behind and fled the spot. The deceased were travelling to Narnaul in Haryana after attending a condolence meeting near Singhana, police said.

102.title: Fake accounting: Mohandas Pai as OYO claims first EBITDA positive quarter
102.article_body: TV Mohandas Pai, the former CFO of Infosys, accused OYO of "fake accounting" after the startup claimed it turned EBITDA positive for the first time in the first quarter of FY23, with an adjusted EBITDA of ₹7.3 crore. "There is nothing like...adjusted EBITDA. They are trying to mislead investors...Regulators and stock exchanges should stop such misreporting in India," Pai tweeted.

103.title: Haven’t planned but definitely look forward to being a mother: Gauahar
103.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan said she is looking forward to being a mother. "I definitely look forward to being a mother. I really hope that happens soon," she said, adding that she hasn't planned for it because she believes it will happen when it's ought to happen. She added she hasn't even had any such conversation with her husband Zaid Darbar.

104.title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra plays football wearing saree, shares pics
104.article_body: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra on Monday shared pictures of her playing football in a saree at the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. In the pictures, Moitra can be seen wearing sports shoes and a pair of sunglasses. She wrote alongside, "Fun moments from the final of the Krishnanagar MP Cup Tournament 2022. And yes, I play in a saree."

105.title: Some iPhone 14 Pro users face camera shaking, rattling on using Instagram, TikTok
105.article_body: Some users are reportedly facing an issue with iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max cameras. Users took to social media to share visuals of the camera shaking and making a rattling noise when using a third-party app like Instagram, Snapchat or TikTok. As per a report, this may be an issue with the third-party app software rather than Apple's hardware.

106.title: Made to feel like a living, elastic bubble: Apple iPhone's 'dynamic island' designer
106.article_body: Chan Karunamuni, the Human Interface Designer at Apple who designed the latest iPhone's 'dynamic island', tweeted, "Its goal is to feel like a living, elastic bubble that can fluidly shapeshift into different alerts and experiences." 'Dynamic Island' is a pill-shaped cutout at the top of iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max. It can display an array of notifications.

107.title: It blew us away: James Cameron on remastered version of 'Avatar'
107.article_body: Director James Cameron said his 2009 film 'Avatar', which is re-releasing at theatres, is looking "better than it ever looked". "We just watched the film recently when we finished the whole remastering process, and it kinda blew us away," he said about the film, which has been remastered in 4K. 'Avatar' is scheduled to re-release on September 23.

108.title: Bangladeshi clerics violate visa norms: Assam govt writes to Centre
108.article_body: Assam government has written to Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) about Bangladeshi clerics violating the norms of their tourist visas by indulging in religious activities. This comes a day after 17 Bangladesh nationals were arrested from Biswanath district for indulging in religious activities. DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said many Bangladeshi clerics have been barred from entering Assam.

109.title: Hyd student invests education loan money into share market; missing
109.article_body: An engineering student in Hyderabad went missing after investing educational loan amount into share market. The student had taken ₹1 lakh from his parents and ₹1.10 lakh education loan from SBI to pay fees. When the boy's parents asked him the reason behind not paying fees, the boy said he had lent it to a friend and later went missing.

110.title: 24-year-old engineering student drowns in private pool in Hyderabad
110.article_body: A 24-year-old engineering student drowned in a private swimming pool in Hyderabad on Sunday, police said. Following the incident, the deceased's family claimed that there was negligence by the pool's management and demanded that action should be taken against them. The deceased had been out with his friends to play cricket and then had gone to the pool, officers added.

111.title: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Doctor G' to release on October 14
111.article_body:
Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Monday announced the release date of his upcoming film, 
'Doctor G'. Sharing a couple of posters on his Instagram account, Ayushmann wrote that his film, which also stars Rakul Preet Singh, will release on October 14. Earlier in a statement, Ayushmann said, "It's an honour to portray a doctor on the screen for the first time."

112.title: Bitcoin falls below $19,000 to 3-month low
112.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell about 5% to a three-month low of $18,387 on Monday. Ether dropped 3% to a two-month low of $1,285 and is down more than 10% in the last 24 hours. Dogecoin, which currently stands as the world's 10th largest cryptocurrency, has fallen 8.11% in the last 24 hours, CoinMarketCap data showed.

113.title: Truth & justice will win: AAP MP on Chandigarh University issue
113.article_body: Speaking about the Chandigarh University video leak incident, AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday said that truth and justice will win. "Our senior police officials are present at the spot. Strict actions will be taken against the accused," Chadha added. "This is a serious and sensitive issue. The Punjab government is standing with the students," he stated.

114.title: Instagram rewards Jaipur student with ₹38 lakh for finding a bug
114.article_body: Neeraj Sharma, a student from Rajasthan's Jaipur, has been rewarded ₹38 lakh by Instagram for reporting a bug. "There was a bug in Facebook's Instagram, through which the thumbnail of the reel could have been changed from any account," reports quoted Sharma as saying. He shared a demo of the bug with Facebook and his report was approved.

115.title: Parineeti announces her next film 'Tiranga', to release on Oct 14
115.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra on Monday announced her upcoming Ribhu Dasgupta directorial, titled 'Code Name: Tiranga'. The espionage action thriller, which will release on October 14, will see Parineeti play a RAW agent. "I hope the audiences enjoy this action entertainer which talks about a soldier's sacrifice in the line of duty for her nation," the director said in a statement.

116.title: Russia attacked Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear plant, reactors not damaged: Ukraine
116.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear company Energoatom said Russian troops struck the Pivdennoukrainsk nuclear power plant in Mykolaiv region on Monday. The blast that took place 300 metres away from the reactors, damaged a nearby hydroelectric power plant and transmission lines but all three power units remained functional. Ukraine's Mykolaiv region has been facing rocket attacks by Russian forces in recent weeks.

117.title: 29-year-old actress Deepa found dead at her Chennai apartment, letter recovered
117.article_body: Actress Deepa, also known as Pauline Jessica, was found dead in her apartment in Chennai, following which police filed a case and recovered a letter from her home. A police official said that the 29-year-old's family members had sent her friend Prabhakaran to check on her after she didn't respond to their calls. Prabhakaran found her dead and alerted them.

118.title: Ola fires 200 engineers to 'minimise redundancy'
118.article_body: Ola has confirmed that it is laying off some employees after a report claimed that the company was planning to fire at least 500 employees across software teams. Ola, however, said only about 200 engineers, including some in the software vertical, have been asked to go. Ola said it is "centralising operations and undertaking a restructuring exercise to minimise redundancy".

119.title: Amarinder Singh meets JP Nadda ahead of joining BJP
119.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh met BJP National President JP Nadda in the national capital ahead of joining the party. “Amarinder Singh is also likely to merge his PLC party with the BJP,” PLC spokesperson Pritpal Singh said. Former CM made the announcement of joining the BJP after he met the Union Home Minister Amit Shah on September 12.

120.title: Rahul Gandhi speaks to Kerala fishermen during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
120.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi interacted with fishermen about their plights at Vadackal beach in Kerala's Alappuzha during the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra." He discussed a variety of topics, including the rising cost of fuel, decreasing subsidies, dwindling fish stocks, and inadequate opportunities. The yatra is in its Kerala leg and will reach Karnataka on September 30.

121.title: Jitendra Singh to take part in Global Clean Energy Action Forum
121.article_body: Union Minister of State for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh will lead an Indian delegation at the Global Clean Energy Action Forum this week in the US. Ministers from over 30 countries will participate in the event to discuss ways of accelerating clean energy innovation and deployment. He is likely to talk about India's commitment to a low-carbon future.

122.title: OYO's FY22 revenue rises to ₹4,905 cr, loss narrows to ₹1,851 cr
122.article_body: Travel-tech company OYO filed financial documents with SEBI stating that its revenue rose 18% to ₹4,905 crore in FY22 from the previous year, while net loss narrowed 45% to ₹1,851 crore. OYO clocked EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation) profit of ₹10.6 crore for June quarter. The company is behind pre-COVID annual revenue of ₹13,413 crore in FY20.

123.title: Chandigarh University is based in Punjab: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher on 'video leak' case
123.article_body: Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher has said she is "morally shaken by the ghastly incident" at Chandigarh University. She tweeted, "The name of my city is being tarnished...I want to clarify that it is based in Kharar, Punjab." It comes after alleged leak of videos of girls taking baths, however, police said they found a video of the accused girl herself.

124.title: 28-year-old Indian student dies after being shot in Canada
124.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian student, Satwinder Singh, has succumbed to the injuries sustained during a shooting in Canada's Ontario last week that also claimed two other lives, police said. The gunman identified as 40-year-old Sean Petrie was shot dead by police. A fundraiser was started to support his parents and send his body back to India.

125.title: US broke promises on nuclear deal, we need guarantee: Iranian President
125.article_body: Tehran would be serious about reviving the nuclear deal if the US guarantees not to withdraw from it, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi told CBS. Raisi said that Iran would be serious about the deal if it is fair but Americans could not be trusted. Tehran wants the UN nuclear watchdog to close probe into uranium traces found at undeclared sites.

126.title: Samajwadi Party's march against BJP stopped, police say 'No permission taken'
126.article_body: Samajwadi Party's march against Bharatiya Janata Party was stopped midway in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said the march was stopped because "the government was afraid of answering questions". Police said the protestors had not taken any permission. "They were assigned designated route which wouldn't have caused traffic congestion. They refused to take that," police added.

127.title: FedEx to close 90 office locations, pause hiring amid decline in global demand
127.article_body: FedEx has said it would be closing 90 office locations, five corporate offices and delaying new hiring amid a decline in its global package delivery business. FedEx Ground's revenue fell about $300 million below company forecasts. This segment handles e-commerce deliveries in the US. On Friday, FedEx shares plunged 21.2%, marking its biggest one-day drop in more than 40 years.

128.title: 3 of family dead after roof collapses in UP's Deoria amid heavy rains
128.article_body: Three members of a family were killed after the roof of a two-storey building collapsed and trapped them in early hours of Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria. The building was reportedly vulnerable and decayed. UP has witnessed several casualties due to wall collapse over incessant rainfall. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath had announced ₹4 lakh compensation for the families of deceased.

129.title: Makers need to understand that it's getting predictable: Tisca on B'wood
129.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said many Bollywood films are failing to perform at the box office because they are "getting predictable and repetitive". She said the makers "constantly look at things from a commercial point of view", which needs to change. She added if the makers put "more energy and emphasis" on writing, Bollywood will have "far better and fresher content".

130.title: BMC to set up its first pet cremation incinerator in Malad in 2 months
130.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up a pet incinerator at cow and dog pound in Evershine Nagar, Malad, which will be operational in about two months. The price for pet cremation is yet to be decided, however, stray animals can be cremated free of cost, said reports. It will be an odourless and pollution-free process, said the official.

131.title: Body of electrician found 2 days after being swept away in Maha creek
131.article_body: The body of an electrician, who was swept away in the strong water current of Kamba Creek near Maharashtra's Bhiwandi amid heavy rainfall, was recovered on Sunday evening. The deceased and his colleague had gone to the spot to fix an electrical issue on Friday. His video of holding himself on high-tension wires trying to save himself had gone viral.

132.title: Charity rescues 372 people trying to cross Mediterranean; 1 dead
132.article_body: A Spanish charity, Open Arms, has recovered the body of one man and rescued 372 people on board unseaworthy smugglers' boats who were trying to cross the central Mediterranean to enter Europe, officials said on Sunday. The deceased was shot dead by smugglers. "The smugglers forced the people to take the corpse with them," a spokesperson of the charity said.

133.title: He's one of the most nuanced actors I've witnessed: R Balki on Dulquer
133.article_body: Director R Balki said he's been observing Dulquer Salmaan's filmography and finds his taste in films "outstanding". He called Dulquer "one of the most nuanced actors" in Indian cinema, and said he's glad the actor liked the script of 'Chup' and agreed to do the film. "I thought a role like this needed someone like him," he added.

134.title: Thousands camp to get best spots to view Queen's funeral; pics surface
134.article_body: Pictures of thousands of people camping overnight in London to get the best spots to view the funeral procession of Queen Elizabeth II have surfaced online. "This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be part of history," a 60-year-old woman who camped in a tent with her two daughters and grandchildren said. Some people were also seen sleeping on the ground.

135.title: Pak will absolutely not default on debts despite floods: Minister
135.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Miftah Ismail told Reuters on Sunday that the country will "absolutely not" default on its debt obligations despite the floods which have affected 33 million citizens. He added that while the path to stability "has become narrower", the country won't default if it continues to take "prudent decisions". Most stabilisation policies are on track, he further said.

136.title: All-women special investigation team to probe Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case
136.article_body: A three-member all-women special investigation team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the Chandigarh University 'videos leak' case, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said on Monday. The SIT will probe the case under the supervision of senior IPS officer Gurpreet Kaur Deo. "The SIT will go to the bottom of the conspiracy," DGP Yadav said.

137.title: I surrender in films I commit to: Ayesha on Akshay spitting water in Khiladi
137.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka opened up about a scene in the 1992 film 'Khiladi' in which Akshay Kumar could be seen spitting water on Ayesha's face. "Once I decide to do a project, with all the clarity, then I would go all out, surrender myself," she stated. Ayesha added, "You must say establish don'ts...before you sign the project, which I have."

138.title: Milk production down by 8 lakh litre/day in Rajasthan due to lumpy skin disease
138.article_body: The lumpy skin disease has affected milk production in Rajasthan as the state witnessed a decline of over 21% in milk production during August. As per the Rajasthan Cooperative Dairy Federation (RCDF), milk collection is estimated to have reduced by 6 to 8 lakh litres per day. In some places of western Rajasthan, milk production has come down to zero.

139.title: Unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II released ahead of her funeral today
139.article_body: A previously unseen photo of smiling Queen Elizabeth II has been released by Buckingham Palace ahead of her funeral. The portrait was taken by photographer Ranald Mackechnie in Windsor Castle in May, ahead of her Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Britain's longest-serving monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, will be honoured with a full state funeral at Westminster Abbey today.

140.title: We can't have new hires not seeing a TCS office: COO Subramaniam
140.article_body: N Ganapathy Subramaniam, the COO of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said the company "can't have new joinees not seeing a TCS office or interacting with role models as mentors". He said that remote working as the only goal will lead to "a very transactional experience". Notably, only less than 20% of TCS' workforce has reportedly returned to work from office.

141.title: Would have stopped the film if Diljit hadn’t done it: 'Jogi' director
141.article_body: 'Jogi' director Ali Abbas Zafar said he wouldn't have worked on the film if Diljit Dosanjh hadn't agreed to do it. "He is so subtle; only his eyes speak in the film. That's what I wanted in the character - someone understated who rises to the occasion," he said. Ali added, "No one could have done it, apart from Diljit."

142.title: Delhi court stays proceedings against Satyendar Jain, ED seeks trial transfer
142.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday stayed the proceedings in a money laundering case against AAP leader Satyendar Jain. This comes after an application filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) seeking the transfer of the entire proceedings from a special court. ED had arrested Jain in connection with a case based on a CBI FIR lodged against him in 2017.

143.title: Ranbir says he, Alia, Ayan went to SRK's home to approach him for Brahmastra
143.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, in a recent interview, said that he, actress Alia Bhatt and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji went to actor Shah Rukh Khan's house when they had to approach him for 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir said that Khan, without thinking for a second, said that he is on board and will do whatever they would want him to do.

144.title: Remo inspired choreographers to become directors: Bosco Martis
144.article_body: Choreographer Bosco Martis, who is making his directorial debut with 'Rocket Gang', said Remo D'souza inspired choreographers to explore direction. "He is one of the choreographers who has started this journey of transforming from a choreographer to a director and definitely inspired many of us," he said. 'Rocket Gang' stars Aditya Seal and Nikita Dutta in the lead roles.

145.title: 72-year-old Mumbai woman practising law with fake licence for decades arrested
145.article_body: A 72-year-old woman in Mumbai was arrested on Saturday for impersonating a lawyer and practising in a family court without proper authorisation for decades. The woman identified as Mordekai Rebecca Joub alias Mandakini Kashinath Sohini had allegedly been practising in various courts based on a fake lawyer's licence. She has been remanded in BKC police custody.

146.title: Following law & order is too much expectation from SP: UP CM on SP's march
146.article_body: Following law and order is too much of an expectation from Samajwadi Party leaders, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Monday, following SP’s march against the state government. "There is no harm if any party asks their questions in a democratic way. Samajwadi Party should take permission for any procession which should not harm anyone," CM Yogi added.

147.title: Astronaut shares pic of Earth at night from space, asks 'how many nations can you spot'
147.article_body: Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti recently shared a picture of Earth at night from the International Space Station. "From the Atlantic looking East towards the sunrise...how many countries and European cities can you spot? I can see my birthplace," she wrote with the picture. She later shared pictures identifying Germany, Spain, UK, Ireland, Greece and Italy among others.

148.title: SP is jobless, they have nothing to do: UP Dy CM on SP's march
148.article_body: Following Samajwadi Party’s march against UP government, Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Monday said it's not related to the benefit of common people. "If they want to discuss this, they're free to do it in the Assembly," Maurya added. Furthermore, he said, "SP is jobless now, they have nothing to do. Such protests will only create problems for people."

149.title: Teenagers steal 4 autos in Mumbai, make Insta reels in it; detained
149.article_body: A 19-year-old mechanic was arrested and a 14-year-old boy was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly stealing four auto-rickshaws worth ₹3,60,000. The duo was identified from their Instagram reels shot while driving the stolen vehicles. As per police, the main accused Armaan Ansari wanted to own autos and started stealing them from roadside while the minor accompanied him for fun.

150.title: Jet Airways relaunch faces delay amid talks with lenders & engine makers: Report
150.article_body: Jet Airways, under its new owner the Jalan-Kalrock consortium, is reportedly facing a delay in its relaunch that is scheduled for this month. According to people aware of the matter, there are unresolved negotiations between the management and engine makers and the airline's former lenders are seeking settlement of dues before the airline buys or leases aircraft.

151.title: It only had menu about our practice: Ashish Nehra on viral pic with paper in IPL 2022
151.article_body: GT head coach Ashish Nehra opened up about his viral picture with paper during IPL 2022. "The paper had nothing. Don't know why people think [it had something important]." He added, "It just had the menu about our practice session." With GT's IPL 2022 win, Nehra became the first Indian to win IPL title as head coach.

152.title: 90 GTA 6 gameplay videos posted online as Rockstar Games suffers massive leak
152.article_body: Rockstar Games suffered a massive leak with around 90 development videos of its much-awaited Grand Theft Auto (GTA) 6 being posted online by the alleged hacker on GTAForums. Various clips from the video game have depicted male and female playable characters. The videos also show the gameplay in a Miami-like fictional city, in line with earlier reports about the game.

153.title: Sidharth Malhotra meets fans at India Gate amid 'Yodha' shoot
153.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who is currently in Delhi shooting for 'Yodha', met and interacted with his fans at India Gate on Sunday. The actor can be seen shaking everyone's hands and posing for selfies in a video shared by a media account. 'Yodha' is scheduled to be released on November 11 and features Disha Patani and Raashii Khanna.

154.title: Akhilesh, SP leaders take out march to state Assembly against UP govt
154.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, other party leaders and workers on Monday organised a march to the state Assembly, from their party office in Lucknow, against UP government. The Monsoon Session of state legislature will commence today. During the march, party MLAs and MLCs will raise issues of unemployment, price rise, crime against women, etc, SP's Rajendra Chaudhary said yesterday.

155.title: Telangana CM KCR names 9-year-old girl who grew up without name
155.article_body: A nine-year-old girl who grew up without a name as her parents wanted Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to give her one was finally named 'Mahati' by Rao on Sunday. The couple, who are from Jayashankar Bhupalpally district, were active members of the Telangana statehood movement. State CMO tweeted that the family was received by Rao and his wife.

156.title: US forces will defend Taiwan against Chinese invasion: US President Biden
156.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion. Asked to clarify if he meant that unlike in Ukraine, US forces would defend Taiwan in the event of a Chinese invasion, Biden replied, "Yes." Taiwan expressed "sincere gratitude" to Biden for "affirming the US government's rock-solid promise of security to Taiwan".

157.title: Bihar govt to introduce 'no-bag day', mandatory games period in schools
157.article_body: The Bihar government will be introducing a "no-bag day" rule in schools and a mandatory games period at least once a week to reduce burden on students, an official said on Sunday. "At least once a week, students will come to schools only with their lunch boxes. The day will be devoted to practical and experiential learning," the official added.

158.title: Hurricane Fiona makes landfall in Puerto Rico, leaving island without power
158.article_body: Hurricane Fiona made landfall along Puerto Rico's southwest coast on Sunday, triggering landslides and knocking out power. The storm ripped asphalt from roads, swept away a major bridge, closed airports and led to 'historic' levels of rain. Fiona made landfall with maximum sustained winds of about 140 kilometres per hour, clearing threshold for Category 1 hurricane, National Hurricane Center said.

159.title: Lady Gaga posts pic of her crying as lightning strikes cancel concert in Miami
159.article_body: American singer-songwriter Lady Gaga was recently forced to cut her Miami concert short, due to a tropical thunderstorm. The singer said that lightning strikes were hitting too close to the stadium. Sharing a picture of her crying, Gaga wrote, "I'm sorry I couldn't finish the show it was too dangerous the lightening was being unpredictable and changing moment by moment."

160.title: Was insensitive and depressing, I couldn't take it: Balki on 'Cheeni...' review
160.article_body: While talking about a review that he got for his film 'Cheeni Kum', filmmaker R Balki said that "it was very depressing". "It was the most insensitive review of that time...People were consoling me, but I couldn't take it because it was written about me. So, from then, I decided to stay away from these critics altogether," he added.

161.title: Shinde camp gets nod for Dussehra rally at BKC, Uddhav's application rejected
161.article_body: The MMRDA gave permission to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena faction to hold the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground in Mumbai. Meanwhile, the MMRDA rejected Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena's application for another plot in BKC to hold Dussehra rally, saying the plot has already been booked for another event.

162.title: KTR asks MP to adopt temple with stepwell in Ranga Reddy, MP agrees
162.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday wished Chevella MP Ranjith Reddy on his birthday and asked him to adopt the Balaji temple with stepwell near Shamshabad in Ranga Reddy. Ranjith replied to Rao, saying, "Would love to take up this wonderful initiative and revive...heritage of Telangana." This comes after a person tweeted that the "700-year-old" temple wasn't being maintained.

163.title: BJP launches 15-day 'Praja Poru Yatra' in Andhra Pradesh
163.article_body: The BJP launched a 15-day "Praja Poru Yatra" from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam against the YSRCP government. The Poru Yatra will cover 5,000 street corner meetings in 175 Assembly constituencies of the state in the next 15 days. "The YSRCP government has completely failed to rule in Andhra Pradesh. Real problems of people are neglected," said BJP MP GVL Narasimha Rao.

164.title: Kartik Aaryan returns to airport gate to meet young fan, video viral
164.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing actor Kartik Aaryan returning to the gate of Jodhpur airport to meet a fan who was screaming his name. The actor can be seen speaking to the security personnel and asking the fan and her guardian to click pictures from outside the gate. The fans were later allowed to meet Kartik.

165.title: Goa CM and Congress turncoat MLAs to meet PM Modi in Delhi
165.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant and eight MLAs who ditched the Congress to join the BJP will be meeting PM Narendra Modi in Delhi today. The Congress turncoats are also likely to meet BJP President JP Nadda and Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "All the MLAs have joined us because they believe in the vision of PM Modi," said Sawant.

166.title: Govt awards 60 startups, gives ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students
166.article_body: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh presented INSPIRE Awards to 60 startups for innovation and ₹10,000 each to 53,021 students to help develop prototypes of ideas submitted, the Ministry of Science and Technology said. More than 6 lakh people from across the country participated in the annual INSPIRE Awards - MANAK (Million Minds Augmenting National Aspiration and Knowledge), the minister said.

167.title: Supreme Court seeks govt report on retired judges’ posting as ad hoc
167.article_body: Supreme Court has sought a report from central government about the appointment of retired High Court judges. It observed that the "judiciary's promise of speedy justice" has taken a hit due to paucity of judges. The apex court had activated the provision for the appointment of retired judges as ad hoc judges to clear pending cases in March 2021.

168.title: Myanmar refugees in Mizoram instructed not to buy land without govt permission
168.article_body: Mizoram government has issued an order instructing Myanmar refugees seeking shelter in the state not to purchase land or run businesses without the knowledge and prior permission from the state government. The refugees should inform about the vehicles they brought from their country to the concerned local or village level committee on Myanmar refugees, the order stated.

169.title: What is the inspiration behind design of Team India's new jersey?
169.article_body: Team India's new T20I jersey called 'One Blue Jersey' was launched on Sunday. The jersey features a lighter shade of blue and its design comprises triangles and petals. Triangles represent a perfect blend of fans' energy, spirit and power, MPL Sports, the official Team India kit sponsor said. Petals are inspired from BCCI logo, denoting merit and loyalty, it added.

170.title: 1 dead, 4 injured as state transport bus collides with truck in Pune
170.article_body: One person died and four were injured after a Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) Shivshahi bus collided with a container truck on Sasvad Road on Sunday night. The bus was going from Pandharpur to Pune's Swargate. Both vehicles, which met with the accident, were removed from the spot with cranes.

171.title: Egyptian Pharaoh Rameses II era-burial cave discovered in Israel
171.article_body: A burial cave from the time of Egyptian Pharaoh Rameses II has been discovered in Israel's Palmahim Beach National Park, Israel Antiquities Authority said. The authority added that the cave was found when a mechanical digger penetrated its roof. Calling it a "once-in-a-lifetime discovery", an expert said that the cave floor is laid out with "vessels untouched for 3,300 years".

172.title: Chandigarh University shut till Saturday, hostel warden suspended over video leak case
172.article_body: Chandigarh University has extended its holiday for students till Saturday after massive protests over the alleged leak of videos of girls taking baths in hostel. The hostel warden was also suspended after students mounted pressure for action over the video leak case, reports said. Police said that the accused girl only sent her own video to her boyfriend in Shimla.

173.title: Will lend my car if anybody wants to leave Cong and join BJP, says Kamal Nath
173.article_body: MP Congress chief Kamal Nath on Sunday said the party wouldn't stop anyone from quitting and that he would lend his car if any member wants to go and join BJP. "What are you thinking? Congress will finish? You are saying some people want to join the BJP. Whoever wants to join the BJP can go," Nath added.

174.title: 38 students complain of stomach ache after UP medical camp visit
174.article_body: As many as 38 female students complained of stomach ache and nausea after they visited a medical camp in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi. The students claimed they were given the wrong medicine.  Sub District Magistrate (Sawayajpur Hardoi) Swati Shukla told ANI that six students were shifted to a civil hospital while the rest, who felt "fine" after treatment, were sent back.

175.title: Retired constable arrested for extortion, impersonating senior in Delhi
