175.article_body: A retired Delhi Police head constable has been arrested for impersonating a senior officer to extort money. The incident came to light when a man approached police saying he received calls from a man identifying himself as SHO Samaypur Badli and later SHO South Rohini. The accused forged an identity card to extort people but got caught in first attempt.

176.title: Pilot dies as plane crashes & bursts in flames at US air race event; video surfaces
176.article_body: A pilot died when their plane struck the ground and burst into flames during the Reno Air Races in US' Nevada. The race operations at the event were suspended after the incident. "Oh no. Oh no," one commentator can be heard saying during the live stream of the event on YouTube. The identity of the pilot hasn't been revealed.

177.title: Ranbir Kapoor says there's a 'Brahmastra Feedback' group for memes, criticism
177.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that there is a 'Brahmastra Feedback' group. He added that everyone shares feedback, memes and criticism on the group and that everyone makes fun of themselves. He also said that all of them enjoy the process as such discussions only happen when a film becomes part of pop culture.

178.title: Ghaziabad doctor booked for false complaint over threats to gain publicity
178.article_body: A doctor from Ghaziabad has been booked for lodging a false complaint alleging that he received threat calls for supporting Hindu organisations. Police said that he lodged the complaint to gain publicity. The accused had alleged he received WhatsApp calls from US-based number but it was found after investigation that the calls were from his patient based in Malviya Nagar.

179.title: Post Malone falls into a hole while performing on stage, bruises ribs; video surfaces
179.article_body: Rapper Post Malone bruised his ribs after he collapsed on stage in the middle of his performance at a concert in US. The rapper fell into a hole that had opened moments before to lower his guitar into but had not been covered afterwards. Medics rushed to the 27-year-old's aid, who returned after a short break to finish his performance.

180.title: I'm opposite of your description of me: Arjun on Varun saying he brags the most
180.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, while replying to actor Varun Dhawan's comment on his picture on Instagram, said that he is the opposite of the description Varun gave about him on 'Koffee With Karan'. Varun, on being asked about the Bollywood celebrity who "brags the most", had named Arjun. He had also named him when asked about "who flirts the most".

181.title: Won't take more than 10 mins to thrash violent protesters: TMC's Mitra
181.article_body: Reacting to the incidents of violence reported during BJP's rally in West Bengal, TMC leader Madan Mitra said that they can retaliate with double the force than the attackers. "If there is an instruction from the party's higher-ups it won't take more than ten minutes to thrash those who were involved in hooliganism and vandalism," the TMC MLA added.

182.title: India reports 4,858 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 2.76%
182.article_body: India reported 4,858 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,664 fresh COVID-19 cases. Health Ministry data said 4,735 recoveries were recorded across India in last 24 hours. The active cases in India now stand at 48,027. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.76%.

183.title: UN condemns 'shameful' year-long ban on girls' education in Afghanistan
183.article_body: The United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) marked one year of closure of secondary schools for girls in the country. In a statement, UNAMA said there was no credible justification for keeping girls out of schools and the Taliban had failed to enable girls to return to classrooms. The Taliban officials said the ban on girls' education was temporary.

184.title: Ola to fire at least 500 employees across software teams: Report
184.article_body: Ola has reportedly started firing employees across software teams. As per a report, at least 500 employees are likely to be fired across different software verticals of ANI technologies amid Ola Electric scooters' declining sales. While over 30 seniors quit in the last two years, Ola laid off around 2,000 employees during the closure of Ola Cars and Ola Dash.

185.title: Viral video shows men celebrating b'day with fireworks on UP road, 2 held
185.article_body: Indirapuram Police have arrested two people after a video showing birthday celebrations on a road in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad went viral. "The video showed a man resorting to fireworks for celebration while others had placed cakes on the bonnet of the car and [were] throwing them at each other," police said. The arrests were made on Sunday.

186.title: QR-based tickets to be introduced in Bengaluru metro
186.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) is going to introduce QR-based tickets, which will allow commuters to buy tickets through the "Namma Metro" mobile application. "Once they enter a station, passengers could place the QR code electronic ticket against a scanner at the AFC gate to gain entry to the platform level," said BMRCL Managing Director.

187.title: 1 app for banking and investing: Jupiter
187.article_body: Banks charge you a penalty for missing your Mutual Fund SIP due to low balance, said Jupiter, a 100% digital banking & investing app. By investing through the Jupiter banking app, users will benefit from No-Penalty SIP that auto-skips to avoid these penalty charges, Jupiter revealed, adding that users would also save on commission fees.

188.title: Many aspirants for PM post but only 1 who is happy to be 'Pradhan Sevak': Irani
188.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday said PM Narendra Modi’s political rivals "desperately" want power in 2024. "They do not realise that there are many aspirants for post of Pradhan Mantri but only one who is happy to remain 'Pradhan Sevak'....[He] functions in corridors of service...he'll return in 2024 with full blessings of public," she said in Patna.

189.title: Start respecting local languages: KTR to IndiGo as woman 'forced' to change seat
189.article_body: After a Twitter user alleged that a woman onboard an IndiGo flight from Vijayawada to Hyderabad was "forced" to change her exit row seat "because she understood Telugu, not English or Hindi", Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao asked IndiGo to start respecting local languages. He tweeted, "In regional routes, recruit more staff who can speak the local language."

190.title: BEST bus daily ridership rises 9% more than pre-Covid level
190.article_body: The daily ridership in Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) buses has increased by two lakh commuters, from 33 lakh to 35 lakh, in the last two months. At present, the increase in ridership is 9% more than the pre-COVID level of 32 lakh daily passengers in BEST buses. Queues are now longer at some bus stops, an official said.

191.title: eBay removes listings of Queen's coffin viewing wristbands selling for up to £70,000
191.article_body: eBay has removed dozens of listings for wristbands for the queue to see Queen Elizabeth's coffin at Westminster Hall. Sellers were offering the paper bands, which mark mourners' place in the queue as memorabilia. Notably, some used wristbands fetched bids of up to £70,000 before removal. An eBay spokesperson said, "These items are against our policies and we're removing them."

192.title: WB Governor pushes Sunil Chhetri for blocking view for pic at Durand Cup; video viral
192.article_body: A video showing West Bengal Governor La Ganesan pushing winning team Bengaluru FC's captain Sunil Chhetri for blocking his view for a photo after the Durand Cup final is going viral on social media. The incident happened during the trophy-presentation ceremony. Several people criticised the Governor on social media, with a Twitter user saying, "Respect the Player."

193.title: Indian knowledge systems have become more relevant than ever: Union Minister
193.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Sunday said Indian knowledge systems today have become more relevant than ever, especially in providing solutions to current global challenges. Speaking at a convocation event in Thanjavur, Pradhan said, "We've inherited great civilisational legacy from our greats like Charaka, Sushruta...Thiruvalluvar that led our education system to solve global challenges."

194.title: Married couple kills self after dispute over milk in Gurugram
194.article_body: A married couple allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram following a dispute over milk, police said on Sunday. Reportedly, the husband was declared dead at a hospital after he consumed poison and when the wife received the news, she also died by suicide, police added. "The bodies have been sent for autopsy and further investigation is underway," an SHO said.

195.title: 21-year-old arrested for making hoax bomb call to Mumbai Police
195.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) arrested a 21-year-old for allegedly making a hoax call to the police control room in June this year. He had claimed that terrorists were present at the Dadar and Parel railway stations. The accused has been identified as Rahul Shripati Ravidas, who hails from the Giridih district in Jharkhand.

196.title: Dog bites Pune policeman as man sets it off at him to escape arrest
196.article_body: A man set off his dog at a policeman to escape arrest in Pune. Police had gone to arrest 24-year-old Ravindra Ghadge, following a tip-off about marijuana sale. Another man, Sagar Ghadge, who was also present at the site, set off his dog at the police. Constable Sandip Patil suffered a dog bite. Police were able to arrest Ravindra Ghadge.

197.title: Chandigarh University students end protest as police assure fair probe in videos case
197.article_body: Students of Chandigarh University ended their protest and vacated protest site by 3:30 am on Monday after police, district administration and university administration assured a fair probe in leaked videos case. The protests had erupted after allegations that a hosteller leaked objectionable videos of fellow students. Police have arrested two people and detained one in connection with the case.

198.title: Over 2,000 kg of banned plastics seized in Mumbai, ₹16 lakh fine collected
198.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) seized more than 2,000 kg of banned single-use plastics in last two-and-half months and collected a fine of ₹16 lakh from shops and dealers using banned plastics. The drive against banned single-use plastics was revived by the Mumbai civic body starting July 1. BMC took action against 318 violators till September 14, an official said.

199.title: President Murmu meets King Charles at Buckingham Palace ahead of Queen's funeral
199.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu met King Charles III at a reception held at Buckingham Palace on Sunday ahead of Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral on Monday. Earlier, the President had visited Westminster Hall in London, where the Queen's body is lying in state. She also signed the condolence book for Queen Elizabeth at the Lancaster House in London.

200.title: Hyd traffic police officer assaulted while on duty; case filed
200.article_body: A case was registered after a traffic police officer was allegedly assaulted when he tried to take a picture of a two-wheeler whose driver and pillion rider weren't wearing helmets in Hyderabad's Panjagutta. According to the complaint, the pillion rider apparently twisted the officer's hand, abused him and threatened him. The pillion rider is a rowdy sheeter, the officer claimed.

201.title: 62,190 people fined in Delhi for not wearing seat belts in 2021: Report
201.article_body: Traffic police fined 62,190 people in Delhi for not wearing seat belts in 2021, Delhi Road Crash Report said. The report said that it is a 35% rise from 45,907 people penalised for the offence in 2020. Meanwhile, the fines for not wearing seat belts have seen a decline over the years, the report further said.

202.title: Shimla man, who called accused girl in Chandigarh University video case, detained
202.article_body: After the arrest of the accused girl student and her 23-year-old boyfriend Sunny Mehta from Shimla in the Chandigarh University video case, Punjab Police have detained another 31-year-old man named Rankaj Verma. Verma had called the accused student while she was being questioned by the warden, The Indian Express reported. His phone number was mentioned in the FIR, it added.

203.title: Divya Bharti, I were neighbours, she used to say 'I'm in love with you': Ayesha
203.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka said that she and late actress Divya Bharti were very fond of each other. She also revealed that the two used to be neighbours and that Divya often told Ayesha that she was in love with her. She also recalled playing Divya's sister in 'Rang' and said they were very close to each other.

204.title: Billionaire businessman Chip Wilson donates $76 mn to preserve Canada's forest land
204.article_body: Billionaire businessman and Founder of Lululemon Athletica, Chip Wilson, has decided to donate C$100 million ($75.8 million) to preserve wilderness in Canada. The donation will be used to purchase forests in British Columbia along with mining, forestry and other resource licenses to turn the lands into parks that indigenous groups can manage and profit from through tourism.

205.title: COVID-19 pandemic is over in US: President Biden
205.article_body: Speaking about COVID-19 pandemic, US President Joe Biden said, "The pandemic is over. We (the US) still have a problem with COVID. We're still doing a lot of work on it. But the pandemic is over." Meanwhile, the US government still designates COVID-19 a Public Health Emergency and the WHO says it remains a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

206.title: SpaceX launches 54 Starlink satellites after 5 delays in its 180th launch
206.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched 54 Starlink satellites after five consecutive delays, completing its 180th launch to date. The flight also marked SpaceX's 42nd launch of 2022. The first launch for the latest mission was attempted on September 13, however, it saw multiple delays due to unfavorable weather. The Starlink satellite internet service is now available on all seven continents.

207.title: I take names a lot, it came in film: Ayan on 'Shiva' dialogue in 'Brahmastra'
207.article_body: While talking about actress Alia Bhatt's repeated 'Shiva' dialogue in 'Brahmastra', filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that while talking, he takes names a lot. "So that stayed in the script and came in the film as well," he added. Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that he and Alia would ask Ayan if they have to keep repeating their names in the film.

208.title: Ludacris' manager Zulu charged with murder in June shooting in US that left him injured
208.article_body: Music entrepreneur Chaka Zulu, longtime manager of rapper Ludacris, has been charged with murder in a June shooting in which he was injured. The 52-year-old turned himself in at the Fulton County Jail on Tuesday, the Atlanta Police Department said. His lawyer stated that Zulu had been attacked by four people and he discharged his weapon in self-defence.

209.title: Arsenal's Ethan Nwaneri becomes Premier League's youngest-ever player at 15
209.article_body: Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on Sunday created history by becoming the youngest-ever player to feature in a Premier League match. He came on as substitute during Arsenal's 3-0 victory against Brentford. Aged 15 years, 5 months and 23 days, Nwaneri broke the record previously held by Liverpool's Harvey Elliott (16 years, 30 days). Elliott set the then record in 2019.

210.title: IAF's Suryakiran Aerobatic Team conducts air show in Odisha's Puri
210.article_body: The Suryakiran Aerobatic Team of the Indian Air Force (IAF) conducted an air show at the Blue Flag Beach in Odisha's Puri on Sunday. As per reports, as many as nine aircraft of the Suryakiran Aerobatic Team of the Eastern Air Command conducted the aerobatic display, which was witnessed by thousands of tourists visiting the city.

211.title: Pune student drowns in water tank at Sinhagad Fort
211.article_body: An 18-year-old student of a junior college fell and drowned in a reservoir at the Sinhagad Fort near Pune on Sunday, police said. He was reportedly having a picnic with a group of students and teachers from his college at the fort. The deceased has been identified as a student of Priyadarshani School and Junior College in Pune's Moshi.

212.title: Mass graves found in Ukraine proof of Russia's war crimes: Trudeau
212.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Sunday said that mass graves found in Ukraine were evidence of Russian forces committing war crimes in the country. Russia needs to be held accountable for its actions, Trudeau added. As many as 440 bodies were claimed to be found by Ukrainian authorities this week near a town recaptured from Russian forces.

213.title: The Rock in 'secret talks' to face Roman Reigns in Wrestlemania 39
213.article_body: Dwayne Johnson a.k.a The Rock is reportedly in "secret talks" with WWE over returning for Wrestlemania 39 to face his cousin Roman Reigns. "The Rock is very interested...he is trying to figure out what...to do," said the report. Next year's event is being billed as Wrestlemania Hollywood and will take place in Los Angeles on April 1 and 2.

214.title: Special tourist train to run on Ambedkar Circuit: G Kishan Reddy
214.article_body: A special tourist train will run on the Ambedkar Circuit, Union Tourism and Culture Minister G Kishan Reddy said. He added that almost 3,000 railway coaches were reserved to promote tourism circuits. The Ambedkar Circuit covers Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, the birthplace of Ambedkar; Nagpur, where he converted to Buddhism; his Delhi residence and Maharashtra's Dadar, where his body was cremated.

215.title: Man Utd looking to sign Griezmann in Jan amid Atletico-Barca tussle
215.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly looking to sign forward Antoine Griezmann, who is currently on loan to Atletico Madrid from Barcelona, in January. Atletico are said to be cutting down Griezmann's playing time this season to force Barcelona to lower their £35 million transfer fee demand. Meanwhile, a report claims that Barcelona are interested in signing United's right-back Diogo Dalot.

216.title: Doesn't matter if Stokes and Hales are not friends: England coach
216.article_body: England white-ball coach Matthew Mott said winning the T20 World Cup is the goal and it did not matter if all-rounder Ben Stokes and batter Alex Hales aren't friends. "And as far as that relationship goes, they might not be best mates and that's OK," said Mott. Hales and Stokes were involved in a late-night street brawl in September 2017.

217.title: Had emphasised seat belt use in interview days before Mistry's fatal road accident: Sachin
217.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar, who is currently participating in the Road Safety World Series, said that it is "very unfortunate" that Cyrus Mistry lost his life in a road accident. He added, "It's a coincidence that two-and-a-half weeks before his death, I had said in an interview that wearing of seat belt was the best and unmatched safeguard."

218.title: Hardik Pandya shares video of him dancing with Virat Kohli, fans react
218.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share a Reel showing him dancing with Virat Kohli on the viral song 'Se Acabo' (Remix). "You know how we do," he captioned the video. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Collab ho to aisa." Another wrote, "Why did Instagram crash?" "Good to see Kohli enjoying," another comment read.

219.title: Was going through anxiety, no one understood my pain: 'Balika...' actor Vikas
219.article_body: 'Balika Vadhu 2' actor Vikas Grover revealed he battled anxiety. "This anxiety you get isn't something that comes to you suddenly, it takes a lot of time to reach you," he added. Vikas revealed his co-stars ignored him when he shared his problem. "No one understood my pain and avoided me...I had to discuss it with my family," he stated.

220.title: Indian badminton duo Dhruv-Arjun wins their 1st international title
220.article_body: World Championships quarterfinalists Dhruv Kapila and MR Arjun registered victories to clinch the men's doubles title at the Maharashtra International Challenge badminton tournament in Nagpur on Sunday. The Indian pair defeated Thailand's badminton pair of Chaloempon Charoenkitamorn and Nanthakarn Yordphaisong by 21-17, 20-22 and 21-18. Notably, this was the pair's first international title.

221.title: Table won't lie after 38 games: Arsenal manager on winning Premier League
221.article_body: Arsenal FC manager Mikel Arteta responded to questions about his team winning the Premier League this season and said, "The table won't lie after 38 games normally." He added that the team should learn from last year's losses and enjoy their football. Arsenal are currently top of the table, having won six out of their seven games in the league.

222.title: Sunil Chhetri-led Bengaluru beat Mumbai for first-ever Durand Cup title
222.article_body: Sunil Chhetri captained the Bengaluru FC to win their first-ever Durand Cup after beating Mumbai FC 2-1 in the finals. Siva Sakthi and Brazilian Alan Costa scored the goals for Bengaluru, while Apuia bagged the lone goal for Mumbai. While Chhetri missed two scoring chances, he provided the assist for the winning goal as Bengaluru got their seventh national title.

223.title: Darul Uloom welcomes UP govt's survey of unrecognised madrasas
223.article_body: Deoband-based Islamic educational institution Darul Uloom has welcomed UP government's decision to survey unrecognised madrasas in the state. Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind President Maulana Arshad Madani said they appreciated the government's initiative but urged the government to not disregard the entire madrasa system if few institutions don't abide by the rules. More than 16,000 madrasas operate in UP.

224.title: Dad Rishi was very critical of Ayan Mukerji's work: Ranbir Kapoor
224.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his late father Rishi Kapoor was "very critical" of 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji's work. Ranbir has previously worked in Ayan's 'Wake Up Sid' and 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'. Ranbir further stated that Rishi would have been happy on seeing the box office collections of 'Brahmastra'.

225.title: Smriti, Harmanpreet's knocks help India beat England by 7 wickets in 1st ODI
225.article_body: Smriti Mandhana (91), Yastika Bhatia (50) and Harmanpreet Kaur's (74*) fifties helped India Women beat England Women by seven wickets in the first ODI in Hove on Sunday. India pacer Jhulan Goswami, who is playing in her last series before retiring, posted bowling figures of 10-2-20-1. With the win, India have taken a 1-0 lead in the three-match ODI series.

226.title: Bus accident leaves at least 9 dead in Costa Rica
226.article_body: A bus crash in Costa Rica on Saturday night left at least nine people dead, local officials said. The accident was reportedly caused by a landslide triggered by heavy rains. The search for at least 30 missing people is still underway, the office of Costa Rica's president informed.

227.title: Food kept on toilet floor served to players at UP sports camp, pic surfaces
227.article_body: The pictures of food and cooked rice placed on the floor of a toilet in a sports stadium in Saharanpur went viral, sparking controversy. The food was served to around 200 players who were taking part in a camp there. A few players raised the matter before a stadium official. The official informed the sports officer, who reprimanded the cooks.

228.title: Kohli is going to be concern for opposition: Mahela Jayawardena
228.article_body: Former Sri Lankan skipper Mahela Jayawardena said that Indian batter Virat Kohli is going to be a "concern" for the opposition teams in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "In the Asia Cup, he (Kohli) batted well, showed what he is capable of...Going forward for India...having confidence that a guy like Virat is going to be a factor," Jayawardena said.

229.title: Don't criticise selected team, it will demoralise players: Gavaskar
229.article_body: Former India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has said that the Indian team should not be criticised once it has been selected as it will "demoralise" the players. "I believe that this team...can bring home the trophy...it's our India team and we all have to back it," said Gavaskar. He was reportedly responding to criticism by ex-players Mohammad Azharuddin and Dilip Vengsarkar.

230.title: Reported budget figures all wrong, economics of Brahmastra not like other films: Ranbir
230.article_body: Referring to reports speculating Brahmastra's budget, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The assets we have created for the film, like the fire VFX or effects for other superpowers, they will be used in three films." He added, "It's not like the figures floating around are correct. It's all wrong. The economics of this film isn't like...economics of other films."

231.title: Lovlina, Shiva in India's squad for Asian Boxing Championships
231.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa made it to India's squad for the Asian Boxing Championships to be held in Amman, beginning October 30. The selection trials were held at NIS Patiala from Thursday to Saturday. Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medallists Nitu Ghanghas, Nikhat Zareen and Amit Panghal skipped the trials.

232.title: Pakistani drone spotted in J&K's Samba, search carried out
232.article_body: The Special Operations Group (SOG) of the J&K Police conducted a search operation near the border areas of the Samba district after villagers informed them of a possible Pakistani drone being present. "The drone was...at least 1 kilometre above the ground," said DSP of the SOG. He added that Pakistan had earlier landed arms and ammunition in India via drones.

233.title: Strip her & film her: Chandigarh University warden while scolding girl who leaked videos
233.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a Chandigarh University hostel warden scolding the girl student who allegedly leaked objectionable videos of other female students. "Strip her naked and film her," the female warden is heard telling other girls in the hostel. The warden is also heard threatening to hit the girl and telling her that she will be suspended.

234.title: Brahmastra reminded me of shows like Mahabharat, Ramayan: Nagarjuna
234.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna Akkineni has said Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra' reminded him of mythological shows such as 'Mahabharat' and 'Ramayan'. "I'd seen in Mahabharat where they had used these astras...and that interested me," he added. "When he (Ayan) was telling me all these things, I was happy...somebody in India is making this. It took me back to all those memories," said Nagarjuna.

235.title: I was surprised to know how down to earth Dhoni was: Varun Aaron
235.article_body: Indian pacer Varun Aaron said that he was "pleasantly surprised to know how down to earth" and approachable former skipper MS Dhoni was when the former met him for the first time. "If Dhoni does well, or he doesn't have the greatest game, he is still the same," he said. Notably, Aaron and Dhoni have represented Jharkhand in domestic cricket.

236.title: Fiona develops into hurricane as it approaches Puerto Rico
236.article_body: Tropical storm Fiona advanced into a hurricane as it moved toward Puerto Rico on Sunday, according to the US National Hurricane Center (NHC). The maximum sustained wind speed recorded was near 130 km/h, clearing the threshold for hurricane strength, the NHC said. Puerto Rico is expected to receive up to 25 inches (63.5 cm) of rain.

237.title: I have faced casting couch: 'Siya' actress Pooja Pandey
237.article_body: Pooja Pandey, who currently stars in Manish Mundra's directorial 'Siya', has revealed that she faced casting couch in the film industry. "I have blocked around 150 contacts on my phone because of that," she added. Speaking about the film, Pooja said she cried while hearing the narration. "[I] found relatability in the character," she added.

238.title: SBI waives off SMS charges on mobile fund transfers
238.article_body: India's largest lender State Bank of India (SBI) on Sunday took to Twitter and announced that it has waived off SMS charges on mobile fund transfers. "Users can now conveniently transact without any additional charges using USSD services," it tweeted. Users will eventually feel less burdened and mobile fund transfers will become more affordable and practical, it added.

239.title: Paarl Royals appoint David Miller as captain for inaugural SA20 league
239.article_body: David Miller has been named Paarl Royals captain for inaugural season of SA20, Cricket South Africa's T20 league. "It makes me immensely proud to have been appointed as the captain of...Paarl Royals. To be able to call it my home, gives me great joy," said Miller. The team is owned by Royals Sports Group, owners of IPL franchise RR.

240.title: Nehra is chilled out, invested in every single player: Varun Aaron
240.article_body: Indian pacer Varun Aaron said that his IPL franchise Gujarat Titans' head coach, Ashish Nehra, is a "very chilled out" person. "He (Nehra) is...always there when you need him, want to have a chat late at night or want to have an extra session in the nets," Aaron said. He added that Nehra is "very much invested" in each player.

241.title: NITI Aayog-like body to be set up in Maha for data analysis: Fadnavis
241.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said an institution on the lines of NITI Aayog will be set up in the state for comprehensive data analysis and to make studied decisions on various sectors. "CM Eknath Shinde has given an in-principle nod to this suggestion," Fadnavis added. A delegation led by Shinde met NITI Aayog's CEO and other officials on Sunday.

242.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz reminds me of Nadal when he was that age: Ferrer
242.article_body: Praising Carlos Alcaraz, Spain's David Ferrer said his 19-year-old compatriot is a special player. "He reminds me of Rafael Nadal when he was that age, that way of assuming pressure, he had no problem with that," he added. Alcaraz won his maiden Grand Slam at US Open last week and became the youngest men's world number one in tennis history.

243.title: Everybody needs to realise that nobody is above the law: Vice Prez
243.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar said that everyone needs to realise that nobody is above the law. Speaking at the '1st Justice JS Verma Memorial Lecture', VP Dhankhar said, "It is a matter of joy that the Central and state governments together are making serious efforts to empower tribals [in Madhya Pradesh]."

244.title: Tesla planning to double vehicle sales in Germany in 2022: Report
244.article_body: Electric vehicle manufacturer Tesla is aiming to double its vehicle sales in Germany this year, according to a report. Speaking to a German weekly publication, a local executive said, "Our goal is to double sales each year, which translates into around 80,000 units in 2022." Last year, Tesla made 39,714 vehicle sales in Germany.

245.title: Video shows UP policeman slapping man who complained of missing niece
245.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows a police inspector slapping a man who had gone to a police station to complain about his niece missing for four days. The Inspector, who is in-charge of Baghpat's Binauli Police Station, was transferred and a departmental inquiry was initiated against him. The man was accompanied by his family members.

246.title: 3 killed, 1 injured as mud house collapses in J&K's Anantnag
246.article_body: Three people have died and one was injured after a mud house collapsed in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district, officials said. The Lieutenant Governor of J&K Manoj Sinha expressed condolences to the bereaved families and Anantnag Deputy Commissioner issued ex-gratia of ₹50,000 each to the victims' families. Sinha asked the district administration to ensure that immediate assistance was provided.

247.title: Case filed against ex-K'taka CM Yediyurappa on corruption charges
247.article_body: Karnataka's Lokayukta Police filed a case against former CM BS Yediyurappa and his family members in a corruption case. An FIR was filed against Yediyurappa, his son BY Vijayendra (the BJP state vice president), his grandson and the then Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) commissioner. The complaint alleged that in return for granting BDA contracts, the accused got bribes.

248.title: Man forces pet dog to run behind car by holding its leash while driving in Rajasthan
248.article_body: A video showing a pet dog being forced to run behind a car by its owner who is driving the vehicle in Rajasthan has surfaced on Twitter. The man, identified as a popular Jodhpur-based surgeon Dr Rajneesh Galwa, is seen holding the dog's leash while driving the car. A case has been registered against Dr Galwa over the incident.

249.title: RBI will take steps to keep inflation in reasonable range: Sanyal
249.article_body: Sanjeev Sanyal, a member of the Economic Advisory Council to the PM, said that the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee will take responsible steps to keep inflation in a reasonable range. Sanyal said that India's inflation is at 7%, pointing out that in several countries inflation is much higher than ours. "I've to commend...MPC and...Finance Ministry for managing it," he added.

250.title: Keanu Reeves to return for sequel to 2005 film 'Constantine': Reports
250.article_body: Actor Keanu Reeves is all set to return as John Constantine in the sequel to his film 'Constantine', according to reports. Francis Lawrence, who directed the first part, has been roped in to helm the upcoming sequel, as per reports. 'Constantine', which was released in 2005, also featured Rachel Weisz, Shia LaBeouf and Djimon Hounsou.

251.title: Karan Johar responds to Twitter user questioning Brahmastra's logic
251.article_body: Referring to a scene in 'Brahmastra', a user questioned the movie's logic, stating, "Tell me how...Ashram is secret and address of ashram is on Google Maps?" Filmmaker Karan Johar responded, "Guru's living like any other person in...real world...no one knows he's the leader of...Brahmansh! That His is the house of...Astras...so his address...in...real world is of course on Google Maps!”

252.title: Must do sequels if writing is good, I'm confident about Gadar 2: Sunny
252.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has said that he is confident about his upcoming film 'Gadar 2'. "We mess things up while doing part two. If the writing is good, we must do a part two...we shouldn't make it just for the sake of it," Sunny further added. The film will be the sequel to the 2001 film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'.

253.title: Never went looking for roles in B'wood, they came for me: Nagarjuna
253.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna, who recently featured in Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra', has said that he always did special roles in Bollywood films. "Whatever I have done right from the beginning, it was important for me to entertain people. All the roles that I did, came looking for me, I never (went for them)," he added. Nagarjuna stated he likes living in Hyderabad.

254.title: Top Vatican envoy comes under attack in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia
254.article_body: A top Vatican envoy and his entourage came under fire as they were distributing humanitarian aid in the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia on Saturday, Vatican News reported. The incident forced Vatican City's Almoner Cardinal Konrad Krajewski and others to take cover. No injuries were, however, reported. The office of the Almoner makes charitable contributions in the name of the Pope.

255.title: 1 dead, 5 injured after wild elephants attack villagers in Assam
255.article_body: A man was trampled to death and five others were seriously injured by a herd of wild elephants in Assam's Baksa, officials said on Sunday. According to villagers, the herd had entered an area from a nearby forest searching for food. The incident took place when the villagers tried to frighten the animals in an attempt to make them retreat.

256.title: Malayalam film 'Udal' to be remade in Hindi, Naseeruddin to play lead: Report
256.article_body: Ratheesh Reghunandan's directorial 'Udal', a Malayalam-language film starring Indrans and Durga Krishna among others, will reportedly be remade in Hindi. According to the report, Naseeruddin Shah has been roped in to play the lead role in the film, which will be helmed by Ratheesh himself. Naseeruddin will reportedly play the role of a visually-impaired man in the revenge thriller.

257.title: Police holds talks with Chandigarh University students amid protests
257.article_body: Punjab Police and Mohali district administration held talks with women students from Chandigarh University amid protests over "objectionable videos" of college hostellers being recorded by a student. Additional DGP Gurpreet Deo said the students are now happy as their concerns have been addressed. Women students were perturbed at the alleged circulation of videos on social media, she added.

258.title: Bus set on fire near WB's Siliguri after local dies in accident
258.article_body: A bus belonging to the Sikkim transport department was set on fire on National Highway 31 near West Bengal's Siliguri after it ran over a local resident on Sunday afternoon. The deceased was returning home on his two-wheeler when the bus hit him from the opposite direction. Locals even stopped firefighters from dousing the flames, police said.

259.title: 1 soldier killed in militant attack near Syrian border: Turkey
259.article_body: One Turkish soldier was killed and another was injured in a rocket attack carried out by militants near the Syrian border on Sunday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. Notably, the attack took place in an area which is known for fighting between Turkish forces and the Syrian Kurdish YPG militia. The ministry added that 12 militants were neutralised in retaliatory strikes.

260.title: Bitcoin falls below $20,000, down 58.9% from year's high of $48,234
260.article_body: The world's biggest cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, fell below $20,000 on Sunday. Bitcoin is down 0.44% in the last 24 hours and is currently trading at $19,817.55, losing $310 from its previous close. Its value saw a drop of 58.9% from the year's high of $48,234 it hit in March. Meanwhile, Ethereum, the second-largest digital currency, dropped 1.45% to $1,421.14 on Sunday.

261.title: Jacqueline summoned by Delhi Police again in ₹200-cr money laundering case
261.article_body: The Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing has summoned actress Jacqueline Fernandez again at 11 am on Monday for questioning in the ₹200-crore money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. Jacqueline was questioned in the case for over eight hours and was given a list of 100 questions on September 14. Actress Nora Fatehi was also questioned in the case.

262.title: Chandigarh University incident is very unfortunate: Sonu Sood
262.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over leaked videos of 60 girls taking baths in the hostel, actor Sonu Sood has said that the incident is "very unfortunate". Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "It's time for us to stand with our sisters and set an example of a responsible society. These are testing times for us, not for the victims."

263.title: Inox Green Energy plans launch of ₹740 cr IPO in 30-45 days: CEO
263.article_body: Inox Wind subsidiary, Inox Green Energy Services, has decided to launch its ₹740 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO) by October this year, CEO Kailash Lal Tarachandani said. The IPO includes equity shares worth ₹370 crore and an offer-for-sale of equity stocks of almost ₹370 crore by Inox Wind. This is the second time the company has decided to go public.

264.title: Man working as auto driver wins ₹25cr lottery in Kerala a day after seeking ₹3 lakh loan
264.article_body: A man employed as an autorickshaw driver on Sunday won a ₹25 crore lottery in Kerala, just a day after he applied for a ₹3 lakh loan to go to Malaysia to work as a chef. Anoop said he has cancelled plans to go to Malaysia and will instead buy a house. He will get ₹15 crore after tax deduction.

265.title: TV actress Nishi Singh passes away aged 50
265.article_body: TV actress Nishi Singh, who appeared in TV shows such as 'Ishqbaaaz', 'Qubool Hai' and 'Tenali Rama', passed away on Sunday at the age of 50. She had suffered three strokes of paralysis in the last few years. She is survived by her husband, writer-actor Sanjay Singh Bhadli, and their two children.

266.title: Man, 5-year-old son killed as CNG truck catches fire in Gujarat
266.article_body: A man and his minor son were killed after their CNG-powered mini truck caught fire in Navagam village in Gujarat's Surendranagar district. The deceased, Lalji Khorani (50) and Amit (5), were burnt to death before farmers working in the nearby agricultural fields rushed to the spot. The mini truck caught fire suddenly when it was negotiating a curve, police said.

267.title: Was pretty put off: Ayesha Jhulka on being replaced in 'Narsimha'
267.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka revealed she was "pretty put off" after she was replaced in the 1991 film 'Narsimha'. "It was quite a controversy, it made it to the headlines that Ayesha Jhulka was replaced, that hurt me a lot," she stated. "More than anything it hurt me because I had not even begun...I was thrown out of films," Ayesha added.

268.title: They need confidence: Jayawardena on India ahead of T20 World Cup
268.article_body: Commenting on Team India's form ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said India have the skill and talent but they need a little bit of confidence with the bat, ball and in the field. India failed to qualify for Asia Cup 2022 final. They lost to Pakistan and Sri Lanka in the Super 4 stage.

269.title: FPIs invest ₹12,000 crore in Indian equities between Sept 1-16
269.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested ₹12,000 crore in the Indian equity markets between September 1-16, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs turned net buyers for first time in July after nine straight months of net outflows, selling ₹2.46 lakh crore from Indian equities between October 2021-June 2022. They had invested ₹51,200 crore in August 2022 in Indian equities.

270.title: Binance misallocates 4.8 mn Helium's HNT coins worth $20 mn: Report
270.article_body: Binance misallocated about $20 million worth of Helium's HNT coins to its customers, Coindesk reported. Binance has misallocated about 4.8 million HNT tokens, many of which were quickly sold for profit by users. The error possibly occurred as Binance mistakenly counted Helium's HNT and MOBILE tokens as one. "We can confirm that this isn't a chain issue," Helium Foundation said.

271.title: India created 80 lakh jobs in frontline industry in FY 2022: Report
271.article_body: Over 80 lakh jobs were created in the frontline industry in the financial year 2022 in India, according to BetterPlace Frontline Index Report. The e-commerce sector contributed the highest to the need for frontline workers, followed by the logistics and mobility sectors, the report said. The average monthly salaries reportedly grew marginally from ₹21,664 in FY21 to ₹22,800 in FY22.

272.title: He was always really humble: Lara recalls meeting Roger Federer
272.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta, recalling meeting Roger Federer who recently announced his retirement from professional tennis, said that he was "always really humble". She also recalled how Federer "stood up immediately" to shake hands with her husband, former tennis player Mahesh Bhupathi's father after the latter went to him to say hello. "It just spoke volumes about...his upbringing," said Lara.

273.title: Excise Dept bulldozes expired beer bottles worth ₹1.5 crore in MP
273.article_body: The Excise Department in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal destroyed thousands of beer bottles worth ₹1.5 crore using a bulldozer. According to the department, the liquor bottles were destroyed as they had expired more than six months ago. Further investigation is underway to ascertain if some of the expired bottles were sold in the market, as per reports.

274.title: Interfaith couple attacked by Bajrang Dal get married in K'taka
274.article_body: An interfaith couple arrived at a sub-registrar's office in Karnataka and legally registered their marriage a week after they were allegedly attacked by Bajrang Dal activists. The couple said they were childhood friends and did not intend to change their religion. Police reportedly provided security to the couple and took them to the police station after the attack.

275.title: Team India's new jersey launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, pic released
275.article_body: Team India's new T20I kit called 'One Blue Jersey' has been launched ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. The new jersey has a lighter shade of blue. The jersey was launched by BCCI and Team India's official kit sponsor, MPL Sports, at an event in Mumbai. Team India are expected to wear the jersey starting with T20I series against Australia.

276.title: Arsenal regain top Premier League spot with 3-0 win over Brentford
276.article_body: Arsenal regained top spot in the Premier League standings with a 3-0 win over Brentford on Sunday. Both William Saliba and Gabriel Jesus scored in the first half. Fabio Vieira, on his full Premier League debut, scored the third in the 49th minute. Arsenal have 18 points from seven matches. They are one point ahead of Manchester City and Tottenham.

277.title: BJP wins in West Bengal's Nandigram cooperative body polls
277.article_body: BJP won the polls in a cooperative body in Nandigram in West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district. The saffron party won 11 of the 12 seats of Bhekutia Samabay Krishi Samity. Notably, TMC, which earlier ruled the cooperative body, won only a single seat, a district official said. The MLA from the Nandigram constituency is BJP's Suvendu Adhikari.

278.title: 8-ft-long python swallows goat in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve
278.article_body: An eight-foot-long python swallowed a goat in a village in Jharkhand's Palamau Tiger Reserve, a forest official said on Sunday. The python, which was not able to move, was rescued by a four-member team with help of villagers and was later released into the forest. The goat was in a maize field when the python attacked and swallowed it.

279.title: I'm sorry I killed the characters so easily: 'Squid Game' director
279.article_body: 'Squid Game' director Hwang Dong-hyuk, speaking about season 2 of the series, has said he feels sorry for easily killing many characters in the first season. "I want to revive Ji-young, but her best friend Sae-byeok also died, so I'm thinking what to do," he stated. The upcoming season is expected to release in 2024.

280.title: There's no way Kohli has to open batting for India in T20 WC: Hayden
280.article_body: Sharing his opinion on whether Virat Kohli should open the batting for India in upcoming T20 World Cup, Matthew Hayden said, "There's no way that he has to open the batting, he has to bat at number three, [as] simple as that." Kohli recently scored 122* in Asia Cup 2022 while opening against Afghanistan. It was Kohli's first-ever T20I century.

281.title: Death toll due to Kyrgyzstan-Tajikistan border clashes reach 81
281.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Sunday updated their death tolls from the latest bout of border skirmishes between them, putting the combined figure at 81. Tajik and Kyrgyz forces clashed multiple times from September 14-16. Both sides have accused each other of using heavy weaponry such as tanks and mortars. A fragile ceasefire between the two countries is currently in effect.

282.title: Where and when will Queen Elizabeth be laid to rest tomorrow?
282.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II will be laid to rest at St George's Chapel located inside Windsor Castle in Berkshire, UK tomorrow. Her coffin will be transported to her final resting place in the chapel after a state funeral at the Westminster Abbey in London. The funeral is scheduled to begin at 3:30 PM (IST) and is expected to last an hour.

283.title: OTT has changed things for me: Tisca Chopra
283.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said in an interview that OTT has changed things for her. She added that OTT is a very democratic medium since the sustainability of an actor only depends on their ability to perform a given job. "It is very liberating as an actor. It is definitely going to be a great decade ahead," Tisca further said.

284.title: Language isn't barrier now, people watch films with subtitles: Naga
284.article_body: Speaking about the North vs South debate, actor Naga Chaitanya said language is not a barrier anymore and people watch films with subtitles. Naga further stated that nothing is going wrong with Bollywood. "The audience picks the content they can relate to the most. If there's an emotional connection, they'll make it win, be it in any language," he added.

285.title: Azerbaijan rebukes Pelosi over remarks on conflict with Armenia
285.article_body: Azerbaijan on Sunday criticised US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi for blaming Baku for the renewed fighting between Armenia and Azerbaijan. "Unsubstantiated and unfair accusations levelled by Pelosi...are unacceptable," Azerbaijan's foreign ministry said. Her remarks dealt a "serious blow" to efforts aimed at normalisation of ties between Armenia and Azerbaijan, the ministry added.

286.title: Our timelines couldn't match: Ali on not directing Salman, Katrina's Tiger 3
286.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar, who helmed 'Tiger Zinda Hai', spoke about not directing 'Tiger 3' which stars Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif. "Adi (producer Aditya Chopra) is like an elder brother...When the third part of 'Tiger' was happening I'd some engagements that I was committed to. Our timelines couldn't match," he said. 'Tiger 3' is being helmed by Maneesh Sharma.

287.title: Chandigarh University announces non-teaching days on Sept 19 & 20 amid protests
287.article_body: Amid huge protests over the video leak incident on its campus, Chandigarh University on Sunday declared September 19 (Monday) and 20 (Tuesday) as non-teaching days for students due to some "unavoidable reasons". However, all faculty and staff members of academic and non-academic departments will report as usual. A notification added that other essential services will continue.

288.title: ONGC bats to remove windfall tax, use dividend to tap into earnings
288.article_body: State-owned ONGC, India's top producer of oil and gas, wants the central government to remove windfall profit tax on crude oil that is produced domestically. Instead, ONGC wants that the dividend be used to tap into earnings from surge in global energy prices. It also said that levying windfall tax was unfair while reaping savings from purchasing discounted Russian oil.

289.title: Shimla man who got 'objectionable videos' from Chandigarh University student arrested
289.article_body: A man from Shimla has been arrested in connection to the leak of objectionable videos of Chandigarh University's female students, police said on Sunday. This is the second arrest in the case as a girl student, who allegedly made the videos and sent them to the apprehended man, was arrested earlier. Police said the arrested student sent her own video.

290.title: NCW writes to Punjab Police over Chandigarh University video leak incident
290.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) on Sunday wrote to Punjab DGP to immediately file an FIR into the video leak incident at Chandigarh University. NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma also wrote to the university vice chancellor to take stringent action against the accused. Massive protests erupted on the university campus over alleged rumours of objectionable videos of women students being recorded.

291.title: Noida policemen take bribe to let off drug trafficking suspect; 3 suspended
291.article_body: Three Noida Police personnel have been suspended and one of them has been arrested for allegedly taking money from a person to let him off the hook in a drug trafficking case. The accused officials were posted at the Sector 57 outpost and action was initiated after a video purportedly showing a constable taking a ₹20,000 bribe went viral.

292.title: Kohli will be a challenge this next week: Cummins ahead of India-Aus T20Is
292.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli ahead of India-Australia T20I series, Australia pacer Pat Cummins said the India batter is going to be a challenge in the next week. On Kohli ending his 1,019-day international century drought at recently concluded Asia Cup 2022, Cummins said, "He's a class player, he was always going to return to form at some point in time."

293.title: Indian man flies to Dubai to buy iPhone 14, spends ₹40,000 on tickets & visa
293.article_body: A 28-year-old Kerala man flew to Dubai to be among the first few Indians to buy iPhone 14 Pro, just hours before its sale began in India on Friday (September 16). Dheeraj Palliyil bought its 512 GB storage model for ₹1,29,000. This was the fourth time that Palliyil purchased the latest iPhone on its first day of sale in Dubai.

294.title: President Murmu pays tribute to Queen in London, signs condolence book; pics surface
294.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday visited Westminster Hall in London, where the body of Queen Elizabeth II is lying in state. President Murmu offered tributes on her own behalf and on behalf of the people of India, the President’s Secretariat tweeted. She also signed the condolence book in the memory of the Queen Elizabeth II at Lancaster House in London.

295.title: Ex-students held for crude bomb explosion on roof of Bengal school
295.article_body: Police on Sunday arrested four boys, aged between 17 and 18, for allegedly throwing a crude bomb on the roof of a school in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas during class hours on Saturday. "Three of the accused are former students of the school...Ten similar crude bombs were seized from the home of one of the suspects," an officer said.

296.title: 7 Bihar policemen including SHOs hurt as mob attacks police station
296.article_body: Seven police personnel, including two Station House Officers (SHOs), were critically injured after a group of villagers attacked the Pranpur police station in Bihar's Katihar district on Saturday, hours after the death of a man allegedly in custody. Hundreds of villagers allegedly damaged vehicles parked on the premises. The deceased was arrested on Friday for possessing bottles of liquor.

297.title: Powerful typhoon with 230 kmph wind speed hits Japan
297.article_body: A powerful typhoon 'Nanmadol' with wind speed of over 230 kmph made landfall in southwestern Japan on Sunday. The Japan Meteorological Agency issued special warning for Kagoshima Prefecture. Notably, such warnings are only issued when "extraordinary" natural phenomenon occurring once in a few decades is predicted in the country. The typhoon officially made landfall at around 7 pm (local time).

298.title: There can't be Opp'n unity without Congress as its fulcrum: Jairam Ramesh
298.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said there cannot be any Opposition unity without "Congress as its fulcrum". "If any non-BJP outfit thinks any alliance sans Congress can provide a stable government for five years, it's living in a fool's paradise. There can never be any Opposition unity minus Congress," Ramesh added. Many regional parties have back-stabbed Congress, he said.

299.title: Congress to fight civic polls in Pune alone: Arvind Shinde
299.article_body: Congress' Pune unit chief Arvind Shinde has announced that the party will contest the upcoming civic elections for Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) alone, without allying with NCP or Shiv Sena. "We have asked all aspirants wanting to contest polls and other workers to start preparing for elections and focus on strengthening the party at ward level," said Shinde.

300.title: Rajasthan man in ICU after alleged brutality during police custody
300.article_body: A man from Rajasthan's Sikar district is in the ICU ward after allegedly being beaten up in police custody and made to do 500 sit-ups. The victim's family submitted a memorandum to the Superintendent of Police, who has ordered a probe into the matter. The SP said the accused had been undergoing kidney dialysis and doctors have reported no injuries.

301.title: Egypt to increase transit fees for ships using Suez Canal
301.article_body: Egypt on Saturday said that it will be raising the transit fees for ships passing through the Suez Canal from January 1 next year. The Suez Canal Authority said that a 15% hike will be imposed for tankers carrying oil and petroleum products. For dry bulk carriers and cruise ships, transit fees will be increased by 10%, the authority added.

302.title: God sent AAP to end corruption like Krishna was sent to end evil: Kejriwal
302.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said, "Like lord Krishna was sent to end evil, god has sent AAP to end corruption, inflation, unemployment and save the constitution and country from evils." He was speaking at AAP's first national convention on Sunday. Around 1,500 elected representatives of AAP from around 20 states were present.

303.title: Man shoots dog dead for barking at him in Bengaluru; case filed
303.article_body: A man shot a dog in the head with an air gun for barking at him in Bengaluru's Maragondanahalli on Sunday. According to police, the accused, Krishnappa, had followed the dog before shooting it in the village. The dog was nursed by Harish, who belonged to the same village. Harish later lodged a complaint with police over the incident.

304.title: It'd be special: Murray on playing with Federer in Swiss' last event at Laver Cup
304.article_body: Ex-world number one Andy Murray said playing with Roger Federer in the 20-time Grand Slam champion's last tournament at next week's Laver Cup would be "special". "I don't know how much he'll be able to play...haven't spoken to him about that," he added. The 41-year-old Swiss announced that he'll retire after Laver Cup. Murray and Federer will represent Team Europe.

305.title: Current policy stance should continue, expect more rate hikes: Ex-RBI Guv
305.article_body: RBI's current policy stance should continue, said former RBI Governor C Rangarajan. "Developed countries are also taking steep rate hikes. I expect more rate hikes," Rangarajan added. He further said there was a steep fall in INR's value against USD with the outflow of capital. "Now, with the inflow of capital, value of INR is expected to strengthen," he added.

306.title: US court bars social media firms from censoring users on 'viewpoint'
306.article_body: A US appeals court on Friday upheld a Texas law barring social media firms from banning or censoring users based on "viewpoint". The firms that challenged the law included the Computer and Communications Industry Association, which counts Facebook, Twitter and YouTube as its members. Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton hailed the ruling as a "massive victory for...free speech".

307.title: ATS detains Maoist with 31 cases, ₹15 lakh reward in Mumbai's Nalasopara
307.article_body: The Maharashtra ATS has detained an alleged member of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) from Mumbai's Nalasopara. The man had come for medical treatment from Jharkhand and is said to have 31 cases, including 11 murders, filed against him. ATS said the man carries a reward of ₹15 lakh and will be handed over to Jharkhand Police.

308.title: Digital market distortions need to be quickly fixed: CCI Chairman
308.article_body: Competition Commission of India Chairperson Ashok Kumar Gupta said the distortions in the digital market need to be corrected promptly. Stating that digital platforms are in a position to influence consumer choices, he said the gatekeeper position of these platforms is raising competition concerns. He added that the regulatory framework also needed to adapt to reflect digital market complexities.

309.title: BJP trying to crush AAP in name of fighting corruption: Kejriwal
309.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "crush" the AAP in the name of fighting corruption. Kejriwal further alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government has been trying to frame his party leaders and ministers in false corruption cases as the BJP is "not able to digest the growing popularity of the AAP in Gujarat".

310.title: Net direct tax collections in FY23 surge 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh cr
310.article_body: Net direct tax collections in FY23 have surged 23% YoY to over ₹7 lakh crore against ₹5.68 lakh crore collected in FY22, according to data from the Central Board of Direct Taxes. While ₹3.68 lakh crore was collected as corporation tax, ₹3.30 lakh crore was collected as income tax. Refunds worth ₹1.35 lakh crore have been issued till September 17.

311.title: You made my day: Mrunal to Polish fan who praised her performance in 'Sita...'
311.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur reacted to a letter sent by a Polish fan to the team of 'Sita Ramam'. In the letter, the fan praised Mrunal's performance in the film, saying that she can't imagine anyone else playing Sita. "I can't express in words how happy I am! You certainly made my day...a big thank you," Mrunal wrote.

312.title: Without jobs there is no future: Rahul Gandhi
312.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that the "Bharat Jodo Yatra is uniting the voices of despair to break the shackles of unemployment". "Without harmony, there is no progress...Without progress, there are no jobs...Without jobs, there is no future," Rahul said. The 52-year-old politician is currently participating in over 5-month long 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

313.title: Should only be inspired by it: Ranbir on Alia working during pregnancy
313.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about his wife and actress Alia Bhatt working during her pregnancy, has said that people should only be inspired by it. "Any kind of criticism is just jealousy and mischief makers and stupidity and we should not take that seriously," he added. The 'Brahmastra' actress announced her pregnancy in June.

314.title: There was no sense of hierarchy with Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan: Ankur
314.article_body: Speaking about working with Kriti Sanon and Kartik Aaryan in 'Shehzada', actor Ankur Rathee has said that there was no hierarchy. "We think that once you achieve stardom, you keep everyone at an arm's length distance. But with Kriti...Kartik, I didn't feel it at all," he added. Ankur stated Kriti and Kartik were "welcoming" when he arrived on the set.

315.title: Om Puri used to get angry if we shot after midnight: Sudhir Mishra
315.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra recalled that late actor Om Puri would get angry if they shot after midnight. He added, "He would be angry but would say, 'Chal ghar pe [Let's go home], I'll feed you bhindi'. My films are mostly set in night, so he would get angry!" Sudhir went on to call Om a "graceful" and "generous" person.

316.title: It'll be made, he has given me a hefty amount: Farah on film with Rohit
316.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan, while sharing an update on her upcoming project with Rohit Shetty, said, "Our film will be made but that's all I can say at this moment." She added that Rohit has given her a "hefty signing amount" and is refusing to take it back. The upcoming comedy entertainer will be produced by Rohit and directed by Farah.

317.title: He has proven himself: Rohit on Umesh's inclusion in India's T20I team vs Aus
317.article_body: Explaining the reason behind Umesh Yadav's selection in India's squad for upcoming three-match T20I series against Australia, India captain Rohit Sharma said the 34-year-old pacer is a quality bowler and has proven himself. Umesh was named as Mohammad Shami's replacement for the series after the pacer tested positive for COVID-19. Umesh last played a T20I in February 2019.

318.title: Condition of roads under my dept extremely bad: Maha PWD Minister
318.article_body: Maharashtra PWD Minister Ravindra Chavan said the condition of roads under his department is "extremely bad" with 40% of the roads being "in their worst condition". "If I am to ensure that all 98,000-kilometre roads are improved...then I will require ₹2 lakh crore," said Chavan. He added that PWD now needs to concentrate on the quality of roads over quantity.

319.title: Amanatullah Khan's supporters booked for heckling, obstructing ACB
319.article_body: A case has reportedly been filed against AAP leader Amanatullah Khan's supporters for heckling officers of the Delhi Anti-Corruption Bureau and causing obstruction during government work. Delhi Police lodged two FIRs against the AAP MLA's aides Hamid Ali and Kausar Imam Siddique. Khan was arrested and sent to four-day custody in connection with alleged corruption in the Delhi Waqf Board.

320.title: Chandigarh University girl sent only her video to boyfriend, other girls panicked: Police
320.article_body: Referring to reported leak of videos of around 60 Chandigarh University girls taking baths, the police stated that the accused girl sent only her video to her boyfriend in Shimla. "Other girls in the hostel saw the accused shooting her own video...They panicked and thought she shot the videos of all others,” Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said.

321.title: No objection to survey of madrassas by UP govt: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
321.article_body: Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's President Maulana Arshad Madani has said there's no objection from the madrassas on the issue of the survey of unrecognised madrassas by Uttar Pradesh government. "There's no anger in...Muslim society about the survey," he said. "[Government] can do whatever it feels is in the national interest but there should be no efforts to target...Muslims," he added.

322.title: Leopard cub with no injury marks found dead inside Mumbai's Film City
322.article_body: A leopard cub, with no visible injury marks, was found dead inside Mumbai's Film City on Sunday. Forest officials dispatched a team to figure out the cause of death after they got a call around 10:30 am on Sunday. The Sanjay Gandhi National Park, which is home to a number of leopards, is near Film City's Goregaon location.

323.title: Dams reduce water release, bring relief for Pune's low-lying areas
323.article_body: Owing to reduced rainfall activity in the catchments, dams in the vicinity of Pune have decreased their water release, bringing relief for low-lying areas that were on flood alert. PMC authorities have said that the relocation of residents in these areas has been put on hold. The state irrigation agency said that precipitation was still entering the dams on Saturday.

324.title: India 2 spots down in global crypto adoption, ranks 4th in 2022: Report
324.article_body: India slid two spots on the list of countries with highest adoption of cryptocurrencies in 2022 to the fourth position, research published by Chainalysis showed. Vietnam holds the top position, followed by the Philippines, Ukraine and the US in the second, third and fifth positions. China has ranked among top 10 countries this year after being ranked 13th last year.

325.title: 1st conviction under UP's new anti-conversion law as man gets 5-year jail term
325.article_body: In a first, a court in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha has served a five-year jail term to a 26-year-old man under the Uttar Pradesh Prohibition of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Act, 2021. The accused was arrested under the anti-conversion law for allegedly kidnapping a 16-year-old girl from another community last year. The state introduced the anti-conversion law in December 2021.

326.title: IRS officer allegedly beats Pune trader with pipes, probe ordered
326.article_body: A Pune-based scrap trader has filed a complaint alleging that a top-ranking Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer posted at the Pune GST Commissionerate physically assaulted him with plastic pipes over GST penalty issues. The victim alleged that he was forced to accept GST liability which he denied. Meanwhile, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta has ordered an inquiry into the case.

327.title: JBM Auto cheated of over ₹1 crore after CFO receives fake WhatsApp messages
327.article_body: JBM Auto, a listed company, was cheated of over ₹1 crore after its CFO Vivek Gupta received fake WhatsApp messages from fraudsters posing as the company's Vice Chairman Nishant Arya. Gupta said he was asked to transfer money in seven accounts. "Since, I was informed...[Arya] is busy in an important meeting, I couldn't...call to make any further enquiry," he added.

328.title: Ponniyin Selvan 2 will release in next 9 months, says director Ratnam
328.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has confirmed that the second instalment of the 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release in the next nine months. The first instalment, which features actors Vikram and Karthi, will release on September 30. The first instalment also features actresses Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Trisha Krishnan. The film is based on the book 'Ponniyin Selvan'.

329.title: J&K LG inaugurates cinema halls, calls it a 'historic day'
329.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha inaugurated multipurpose cinema halls in Pulwama and Shopian, calling it a "historic day". The Union Territory has got cinema halls after three decades and three years after the abrogation of Article 370. "It offers facilities ranging from movie screening, infotainment and skilling of youth," the LG tweeted.

330.title: Russia offering $3,000/month to those willing to fight in Ukraine
330.article_body: Russia's army is offering nearly $3,000 (₹2,38,951) per month to those willing to enlist as "contract" soldiers for the war in Ukraine. An officer associated with the recruitment of such soldiers said that Russians and foreigners aged 18-60 years would be eligible for enlistment. Reportedly, the minimum monthly wage on offer is $2,700 (₹2,15,056), which is thrice the national average.

331.title: Chhattisgarh Congress passes resolution backing Rahul as party chief
331.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as the party President. "Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan have made this proposal. It has been done in two states but if this proposal comes from other states, then Rahul ji should rethink about this matter," said Chhattisgarh CM. The Congress Presidential election will be held on October 17.

332.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts for next 2 days
332.article_body: Some areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm on September 19 (Monday) and September 20 (Tuesday). The power outage is planned due to some repair and maintenance work undertaken by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. The areas that will be affected due to power cuts include Wilson Garden and Shanti Nagar.

333.title: Scientists develop laughter model to make robots more human
333.article_body: Scientists at Japan's Kyoto University have developed a model of shared laughter to make robots more human. Scientists incorporated the model into Android Erica, a humanlike robot, to help it choose between solo laughs, social laughs and gleeful laughter. The model combines all three laughters rather than just detecting a laughter and responding to it, said the research's lead author.

334.title: UP's law & order situation an example for country, world: CM Yogi
334.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said law and order of UP is being seen as an example for the country and the world. People often discuss UP's law and order situation as an example of the state where riots, anarchy and hooliganism were considered to be at their peak before 2017 but now the rule of law has been established there.

335.title: 27-yr-old man shot dead by 3 bike-borne men in Gurugram
335.article_body: A supervisor of a private company was shot dead by three bike-borne men near Sirhaul village in Gurugram. The deceased, Pankaj Kumar (27), was a native of Samastipur in Bihar and was shot dead when he was walking to his office located in Udyog Vihar Phase 4. An FIR has been registered under section 302 (murder) of the IPC.

336.title: What are the names of the 8 cheetahs brought to India from Namibia?
336.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday released eight cheetahs, three males and five females, brought from Namibia at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park, marking the return of once-extinct cheetah back in India. The male cheetahs are named Freddie, Elton and Oban, while the female cheetahs are named Siyaya, Aasha, Tbilisi, Sasha and Savannah. Aasha was named by PM Modi on Saturday.

337.title: She used to talk to me about her kids, like any simple girl: Huma on Madhuri
337.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, recalling working with Madhuri Dixit in the film 'Dedh Ishqiya', said that she made the atmosphere very comfortable. Calling the 55-year-old actress a "sweet human being", Huma said that she used to talk to her about her house and children, "just like any simple girl and like any normal housewife". 'Dedh Ishqiya' was released in 2014.

338.title: Always looked up to him, he’s achieved so much: Nagarjuna on Chiranjeevi
338.article_body: Nagarjuna's upcoming film 'The Ghost' and Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather' are set to clash at the box office on October 5. Talking about the clash, Nagarjuna said he is "worried and anxious" about competing with Chiranjeevi, who he tagged as "a mighty opponent". Nagarjuna added that he "always looked up to" Chiranjeevi. "He has achieved so much," he said about the actor.

339.title: India has gained new confidence under PM Modi: CM Yogi
339.article_body: India has gained new confidence under PM Narendra Modi, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Saturday on the occasion of PM Modi's birthday. "Even the international community today is unable to ignore India when taking decisions. This shows India's strength," CM Yogi added. Furthermore, he said, PM Modi's contribution to India's current growth story started with Kashi.

340.title: Principal, teachers allegedly beat Class 1 girl in UP; FIR filed
340.article_body: An FIR was filed against a principal and two teachers of a school in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj after they allegedly beat a Class 1 girl, police said. According to the complaint, the girl told her parents that the accused had apparently punched, slapped and canned her. The father also claimed that the accused threatened him when he went to school.

341.title: FIR filed against Yediyurappa, his son in alleged ₹12 crore bribe case
341.article_body: A First Information Report (FIR) has been registered by the Karnataka police against BJP leader BS Yediyurappa, his son and state BJP vice-president BY Vijayendra in a corruption case. The FIR was registered based on a complaint, accusing the Bangalore Development Authority officials of demanding ₹12 cr bribe to award a contract to a builder for a government building's construction.

342.title: AAP appoints Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of party's Gujarat unit
342.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has appointed Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha as the co-incharge of the party's unit in Gujarat. He'll be supervising the party's political and election affairs in the state, where Assembly elections are scheduled for this year. "I'll put in my blood, sweat...and toil to meet...expectations of my party. Gujarat wants change...Gujarat wants [Arvind Kejriwal]," Chadha said.

343.title: Ranveer Singh to be part of Rohit Shetty's 'Khatron Ke…' finale: Report
343.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, along with his 'Cirkus' co-stars, will reportedly be a part of the finale episode of Rohit Shetty-hosted show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. While the finale stunt has been shot in Cape Town, the makers are reportedly shooting the winner announcement bit of the episode on Sunday in Mumbai. The episode will also see ex-contestants in attendance.

344.title: Govt to give Pune ₹50 cr every year for flood management
344.article_body: Under its Urban Flood Risk Management project, the central government has decided to include Pune among seven cities. The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has decided to allocate ₹50 crore every year, for the next five years, to Pune. This project helps urban areas that face floods which affects their civic life and essential services.

345.title: Don't delay, police will freeze accounts: B'luru Police on cyber crime
345.article_body: Bengaluru Joint Commissioner of Police Raman Gupta urged the public to not delay reporting cyber crimes. "Immediately after receiving the complaint, the police will freeze the bank accounts of the accused and trace him/her. So sooner the crime is reported, the higher the probability of getting the money back," he added.

346.title: 6.8-magnitude earthquake causes entire train to shake in Taiwan, video surfaces
346.article_body: A 6.8-magnitude earthquake hit Taiwan on Sunday, causing a convenience store to collapse and leading to train carriages being derailed. A video of a train trembling due to the earthquake also surfaced on social media. This was the second earthquake in less than 24 hours in Taiwan after a 6.4-magnitude tremor hit the Taiwanese city of Taitung on Saturday.

347.title: He's an X-factor in Australia's T20 WC squad: Cummins on Singapore-born David
347.article_body: Australia pacer Pat Cummins said Singapore-born batter Tim David is an "X-factor" for the defending champions' T20 World Cup squad. David has played 14 T20Is for Singapore and has been named in Australia's squad for upcoming T20I series against India. "It's great to see...David get his chance," he added. David is yet to make his debut for Australia.

348.title: BJP leaders flummoxed by response to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra’: Chidambaram
348.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said BJP leaders are flummoxed by the response to the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and are resorting to old tools of misinformation, lies and abuse. Earlier today, Congress tweeted, "As we keep walking in the...yatra, we experience an India yet unseen. Every person we've come across carries exuberating courage and...will to fight for India."

349.title: Mahindra Susten sells 30% stake to Canadian fund for ₹2,371 crore
349.article_body: Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan (OTPP) will acquire 30% stake in the Mahindra Group's renewable energy arm Mahindra Susten Pvt Ltd (MSPL) for ₹2,371 crore, a regulatory filing said. The Mahindra Group and the Canadian fund have said that they will invest around ₹4,550 crore in MSPL, the filing showed. The transaction involves setting up an Infrastructure Investment Trust.

350.title: Vedanta-Foxconn plant site in Guj to be finalised in 2 weeks: Official
