350.article_body: Vedanta and Foxconn are likely to finalise the site for the semiconductor plant in Gujarat in the next two weeks, state's Science and Technology Department Secretary Vijay Nehra said. Nehra added that various sites in Gujarat are being examined on the basis of technical aspects, commercial viability and connectivity. The production in the semiconductor unit will begin in two years.

351.title: 2 small planes collide midair in US, 3 people killed; pics of planes' debris surface
351.article_body: Two small airplanes collided in midair near Denver in US on Saturday, killing three people. Two people were found dead in one wreckage, and one person in the other, an official said. It was not known what might have caused the crash between the four-seater Cessna 172 and the Sonex Xenos, a light, aluminium aircraft that can seat two.

352.title: Hrithik dances to 'Vikram...' song 'Alcoholia' with fans, video surfaces
352.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan danced with his fans at the 'Alcoholia' song launch event in Mumbai, a video of which has also surfaced online. The actor also taught a few steps to his fans. The song, sung by Vishal-Sheykhar, Snigdhajit Bhowmik and Ananya Chakraborty, is a part of Hrithik's upcoming film 'Vikram Vedha', which is slated to release on September 30.

353.title: 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits Taiwan; train carriages derailed
353.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck Taiwan's southeastern part on Sunday, the self-governing island's weather bureau said. Two people were reported trapped under the rubble of a collapsed building in Hualien county. The earthquake also caused three railway carriages to get derailed. However, the roughly 20 passengers aboard were evacuated without any injuries, Taiwan's railway authorities said.

354.title: Doctors remove 55 batteries from 66-yr-old woman's stomach & gut in Ireland
354.article_body: Surgeons at an Ireland hospital removed 55 batteries from a 66-year-old woman's stomach and gut after she swallowed them in an apparent act of deliberate self-harm. The woman passed five batteries out of her body naturally, while 46 were removed by surgeons from her abdominal cavity. The remaining four batteries were "milked" into the rectum and removed through the anus.

355.title: 411 trees to be chopped for Bengaluru’s Airport metro line
355.article_body: Karnataka High Court has allowed Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) to cut down 411 trees along KR Puram-Kempegowda International Airport Line's middle section. A total of 4,110 saplings will be planted in Aero Space Park to compensate for this. A BMRCL official said they were waiting for the permission for over a month.

356.title: More fatal accidents at night, West Delhi more prone to fatal crashes: Report
356.article_body: Delhi Road Crash Report 2021 said that road accidents during the day are more than those during night in Delhi but night crashes result in more deaths. The report said that out of the 2,673 daytime crashes, 561 resulted in fatalities while of the 2,047 nighttime crashes, 645 ended in fatalities. West District is the most crash-prone region, report added.

357.title: Thane residents clean creeks to mark Int'l Coastal Cleanup Day
357.article_body: Residents from Thane along with a few environmental activists on Saturday conducted a drive to clean all the creek areas in the district to mark International Coastal Cleanup Day. The Thane Municipal Corporation and the District Collector also joined the drive. "We collected 1,630 kg of coastal waste (from the creeks) between 7 am and 9 am," a resident said.

358.title: Sextortion racket operating from beauty parlour busted in Ghaziabad
358.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have busted a sextortion racket and arrested three women who operated the racket from a beauty parlour in Vijay Nagar. The woman used to make calls to people registered on an online chat platform, record videos of compromising conversations and sexual acts and subsequently used to extort money from them. Police have recovered ₹13 lakh during the investigation.

359.title: Man gets struck by lightning while playing PlayStation in living room in UK, shares pics
359.article_body: A UK man named Aidan Rowan got struck by lightning while playing PlayStation inside his living room. "There was...very loud crack of thunder and I...felt...very heavy sensation all over and then...searing heat in my right arm where there are now burns," he said. He stated doctors theorised that lightning "bounced off water and through the window" to strike him.

360.title: DMart's Noronha, one of India's richest CEOs, buys ₹70 crore home in Mumbai: Report
360.article_body: Retail chain DMart's CEO Ignatius Navil Noronha has purchased a home in Mumbai's Bandra East area for about ₹70 crore, according to registration documents on Zapkey. Noronha, who is one of the richest CEOs in India, bought two apartments in the under-construction project Rustomjee Seasons. The apartments have a total carpet area of 9,552 square feet and 10 car parkings.

361.title: PM is pathological liar, 'Project Cheetah' initiated in 2009: Jairam
361.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted a letter which, he said, initiated ‘Project Cheetah’ in 2009. "Our PM is a pathological liar," Ramesh tweeted. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi said for decades no effort was made to rehabilitate cheetahs. In the letter, Ramesh had asked Dr MK Ranjitsinh of Wildlife Trust of India to prepare a "detailed roadmap for reintroduction of the cheetah".

362.title: Rohit Sharma's 'khichdi' response on being asked about India openers goes viral
362.article_body: During the press conference ahead of India-Australia series, captain Rohit Sharma was asked about who will open for India in T20 World Cup. Rohit stated KL Rahul would open alongside him, with Virat Kohli being the third opening option. "Let me clarify...We're very clear with our thought process...Hamare andar kya khichdi pak rahi hai wo hume pata hai," he added.

363.title: Govt to sell B'luru's Jakkur Aerodrome's land to private parties: Activist
363.article_body: Human Rights Protection and Corruption Eradication Forum State President Raghavendra SR has filed a complaint regarding a land deal worth ₹1,500 crore regarding Bengaluru's Jakkur Aerodrome. He alleged Karnataka government of planning to give over 75 acres of Aerodrome's land to "private parties with vested interests". This will make safe aircraft landings at Aerodrome "impossible", he said.

364.title: CBI, forensic officials inspect nightclub where Sonali Phogat was allegedly drugged
364.article_body: The CBI team, along with forensic officials, reached the Curlies nightclub at Anjuna beach to investigate the death of actor Sonali Phogat. Curlies was the club where the actor was allegedly drugged by two of her male companions. The CBI team took over the probe from Goa police on September 15 and registered an FIR in the case.

365.title: 2 senior citizens killed in elephant attacks in Chhattisgarh
365.article_body: Two senior citizens were killed in separate incidents of elephant attacks in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Sunday. The first incident took place near Abhaypur village, where the deceased, Manbodh God (70), was having dinner before an elephant trampled him to death, officials said. Meanwhile, the second deceased, Raimati God (70), was attacked by the same herd in Janardanpur village.

366.title: Russia may step up attack on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine: UK
366.article_body: UK has said that Russia widened its strikes on civilian infrastructure in Ukraine in the past week and is likely to expand its target range further. Five civilians were killed in Russian strikes in Donetsk region. Several dozen high-rise and private buildings, gas pipelines and power lines have also been damaged in Nikopol due to Russian strikes, officials said.

367.title: Inspired by old Hollywood films: Stylist on Zendaya's Emmy outfit
367.article_body: Zendaya's stylist Law Roach said the actress' Emmy Awards outfit was inspired by "old Hollywood movies" and "Valentino's fall 1987 collection". He said the outfit was put together in a week. "This look could have been perceived as costumey, but it's the way that she carries herself on the carpet, where it never ends up looking that way," he added.

368.title: 'Ocean's Eleven' actor Henry Silva passes away at 95
368.article_body: Veteran American actor Henry Silva, who starred in films like 'Ocean's Eleven' and 'The Manchurian Candidate', passed away on Wednesday aged 95. He died of natural causes in California, his son Scott told Variety. Henry, who made his acting debut in the 1950s, appeared in over 100 projects. He also voiced Bane in the animated series 'The New Batman Adventures'.

369.title: Woman found murdered in Delhi, missing flatmate prime suspect
369.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was found murdered with a sharp injury on her neck at her rented flat in Delhi's Maujpur on Saturday. DCP (Northeast Delhi) Sanjay Kumar Sain said that the woman was living with a man at the flat, adding that he is the prime suspect in the case. He is at large and police are looking for him.

370.title: It felt surreal: Riddhima on walking the ramp at London Fashion Week
370.article_body: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, daughter of Neetu Kapoor and late Rishi Kapoor, recently walked the ramp at London Fashion Week for the UK-based fashion brand Helen Anthony. Talking about the experience, Riddhima said it "felt surreal" and "amazing". "I can't believe it is all over. It was quite an experience, and it was just amazing with a capital A," she said.

371.title: Uttar Pradesh govt transfers 14 IAS officers, 10 districts get new DMs
371.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has reshuffled 14 IAS officers, including District Magistrates of 10 districts. New DMs have been appointed in Hardoi, Barabanki, Mirzapur, Ghazipur, Agra, Chandauli, Mathura, Pilibhit, Bhadohi and Sant Kabir Nagar. Meanwhile, Relief Commissioner and Secretary Revenue Department Ranveer Prasad has also been assigned the responsibility of Housing Commissioner.

372.title: Sushant's sister says she saw the late actor in dreams, shares his picture
372.article_body: While sharing his picture on Twitter, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Priyanka Singh said that she saw her late brother in her dreams. "What life has mercilessly denied me...I seemed to steal in the peace of my sleep...a relaxed setting in your playful yet intense company, discussing...your favourite perfume and the fragrance lingers on all around me," she wrote.

373.title: Feels a bit different: Cameron Diaz on returning to acting after hiatus
373.article_body: Hollywood actress Cameron Diaz said making a comeback to acting after a long hiatus felt "a little bit different". Diaz will star with Jamie Foxx in her upcoming film 'Back in Action'. The two had previously shared the screen space in Diaz's last on-screen appearance, 'Annie' (2014). "He's so great, so professional and talented," Diaz said about Foxx.

374.title: Hundreds of court cases will be settled once UCC introduced in U’khand: CM
374.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the Uniform Civil Code will settle hundreds of cases pending in various courts of the state once it comes into force. "We want equal rights and equal law(s), irrespective of different faith and ethnicity for those living in the Himalayan state having international border with China and Nepal," News18 quoted Dhami as saying.

375.title: Another huge problem: LinkedIn Co-founder on Musk's plan to buy Twitter
375.article_body: LinkedIn Co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that he was worried when he first learned about his friend Tesla CEO Elon Musk's plan to buy Twitter. In a podcast interview, Hoffman said, "I read the tweet and I think I had the reaction of most people, it was like, 'Oh my God, another huge problem'. He's already dealing with a large number."

376.title: My father had always been a box office guy: Ranbir on Rishi Kapoor
376.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor called his late father Rishi Kapoor "a box office guy", who was "very respectful of the numbers and how the film fared at the ticket window". Ranbir said Rishi "would have been very happy" to see how 'Brahmastra' was performing at the box office. He added that Rishi would've also said, "Let's see how the second-weekend fares".

377.title: Was numb, couldn't function: Ayesha Jhulka on Divya Bharti's death
377.article_body: Actress Ayesha Jhulka opened up about her friendship with late actress Divya Bharti and shared that she was one of the first few to learn about her death. "I was numbed. I just couldn't function," Ayesha shared. The actress remembered that the dubbing of her film 'Rang' was cancelled thrice because she was "just crying" and "wasn't able to dub".

378.title: Poland opens new canal; PM says, it'll 'break dependence on Russia'
378.article_body: Poland on Saturday opened a new sea waterway, which the country's leaders say will stop its need to take permission from Russia for ships to travel from Baltic Sea to the ports of Vistula Lagoon. The country's PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that with the opening of this shipping canal, Poland will "break the last bonds of [its] dependence on Russia".

379.title: Death toll from Tajikistan border conflict rose to 36: Kyrgyzstan
379.article_body: Kyrgyzstan said on Sunday that its death toll from the border conflict with Tajikistan has risen to 36, while 129 people have been injured. This comes after both the countries accused each other of deploying heavy weaponry at the border after a clash broke out. Kyrgyzstan added that it had evacuated 1.37 lakh people from the area amid the conflict.

380.title: Govt shares pic of cheetah lying on its back a day after arriving in India
380.article_body: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has shared a picture of one of the cheetahs that were released in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park by PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. "Cheetah's after welcome party at Kuno National Park," the ministry wrote with the picture showing the cheetah lying on its back.

381.title: India lose their Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against Norway 1-3
381.article_body: Indian tennis team lost their Davis Cup 2022 World Group I tie against hosts Norway 1-3 in Lillehammer on Saturday. India were trailing 0-2 after first day. Doubles pair of Saketh Myneni-Yuki Bhambri was defeated by Casper Ruud-Viktor Durasovic 6-3, 3-6, 6-3 in the first match of the second day. Sumit Nagal won his match to make the tie 1-3.

382.title: BJP MP challenges Bihar CM to contest 2024 Lok Sabha polls from UP
382.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi challenged Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to contest Lok Sabha elections from any constituency in UP. "Nitish ji should try to contest the Lok Sabha election from Phulpur...or from anywhere in UP. If he fails to save the deposit, then he shall return to Bihar as a candidate who lost his deposit," Sushil said.

383.title: Man poses as Army officer to cheat aspirants in Pune; arrested
383.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly posing as an Army officer on social media and cheating aspiring candidates by promising them defence job offers in Pune. Police have seized an Army uniform and some fake documents identifying him as an Army officer. The accused visited campuses of some defence establishments in the past.

384.title: 27 killed, 20 injured as bus crashes in China's Guizhou province
384.article_body: A bus crashed in southwest China's mountainous Guizhou province, killing 27 people and injuring 20, local police said. The bus carrying 47 people reportedly rolled over on a highway. The incident took place in the early hours of Sunday morning in Qiannan prefecture located in a remote and mountainous part of Guizhou province which is home to several ethnic minorities.

385.title: Be ready to go to jail: Delhi CM Kejriwal at AAP national convention
385.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that BJP-led central government will put everyone in jail, adding, "Be prepared to go to jail for 3-4 months." He was speaking at AAP's national convention in Delhi attended by the party's MLAs and MPs among others from across the country. "BJP-led central government...spent ₹7,000-8,000 crore on poaching of MLAs," Kejriwal said.

386.title: HC orders BBMP to halt encroachment demolition at Bagmane Tech Park
386.article_body: Karnataka HC has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to halt its demolition drive at Bagmane Tech Park for alleged encroachment of stormwater drains. The Park's petition had alleged that BBMP officials were attempting to tear down compound walls without conducting a survey or giving prior notice. The petitioners said they'd themselves demolish compound walls if they're found guilty.

387.title: Automobile firm defrauded of over ₹1 crore in Gurugram
387.article_body: A private automobile company was allegedly duped of over ₹1 crore by a fraudster in Gurugram. The suspect sent texts to the company's chief financial officer, Vivek Gupta, by posing as the firm's VC and asked him to transfer funds to seven different bank accounts. Gupta subsequently discovered that the sender was not the VC and someone else impersonated him.

388.title: Chahatt Khanna breaks silence on 'links' with conman Sukesh, says 'It makes no sense'
388.article_body: After reports claimed she met conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar in Tihar jail, actress Chahatt Khanna called it a "twisted" portrayal of reality. She said, "There is a lot I want to say, but then I feel why should I have to clarify myself. It makes no sense right now." She added, "My family and I are just laughing reading the reports."

389.title: Cong pres or not, Rahul will have pre-eminent place in party: Chidambaram
389.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has stated that Rahul Gandhi will always have a "pre-eminent place" in the party irrespective of whether he is president or not. He further said that Rahul is the "acknowledged leader" of the rank and file of the party. Rahul has declined the party president post so far but may change his mind, Chidambaram added.

390.title: Man on roller skates almost collides with King Charles' car, video surfaces
390.article_body: A video of a man on roller skates almost colliding with King Charles’ car surfaced online. The incident took place when King Charles was on his way to Westminster Hall to perform a vigil at Queen Elizabeth's coffin on Friday. While the man was handcuffed at the scene, police let him leave after they found he had no malicious intent.

391.title: Ukrainians search for dead relatives at grave site in town of Izium
391.article_body: Residents of the Ukrainian town of Izium searched for dead relatives as emergency workers continued to dig out bodies after Russian forces were driven out of the region. The causes of death have not been ascertained, however, residents said some died in an airstrike. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said investigators have found evidence of torture against people buried in Izium.

392.title: Mohammad Shami ruled out of T20I series against Australia due to COVID-19
392.article_body: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami will not be able to take part in the upcoming three-day T20I series against Australia after testing positive for COVID-19, the BCCI said. Fast bowler Umesh Yadav, who last played a T20I in 2019, has been named Shami's replacement. The T20I series between India and Australia will begin on Tuesday.

393.title: I still give Kim advice, it's going to go to the kids: Kanye
393.article_body: Rapper Kanye West in an interview has stated that he still gives his ex-wife Kim Kardashian advice on things that can help, adding, "Because that's going to go to the kids." He further said, "She's still got to, basically 80% of the time, raise those children." The two have four children together and Kim filed for separation in February 2021.

394.title: Congress leader held for sexually assaulting 20-yr-old beautician at his salon in K'taka
394.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader, Manoj Karjagi, was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 20-year-old beautician at his salon in the Dharwad district. The woman reportedly alleged that Karjagi tried to hug and kiss her after coming to the salon on Saturday. She screamed after the incident, following which some people came to help her, according to reports.

395.title: Alia can get daunting, she's boisterous and bullies you: Ranbir
395.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has called his wife actress Alia Bhatt daunting in an interview, adding that she is "a bit boisterous" and "can bully you". He further said that he has the best manager in the world and that is Alia. "She's got the best management skills in the world...She just makes it happen and...makes my life easy," Ranbir added.

396.title: 60-year-old man climbs 48-storey skyscraper in Paris with no rope, pics surface
396.article_body: Climber Alain Robert, also known as "French Spiderman", scaled a 48-storey skyscraper in Paris without using ropes or harness to mark his 60th birthday. "I want to send people the message that being 60 is nothing. You can still do...fabulous things," he said. Robert began climbing in 1975 and has climbed the 613-foot-tall TotalEnergies tower in Paris on numerous occasions.

397.title: Kerala man arrested after severing separated wife's hands with machete
397.article_body: Kerala Police has arrested a man for allegedly severing both hands of his wife with a machete. The accused also chopped off the victim's hair and inflicted injuries on her head. The two lived together for only one year and had been living separately for the past five years. Their divorce case has been proceeding in a family court.

398.title: SpaceX to launch 54 Starlink satellites after 5 delays on Sept 18
398.article_body: SpaceX has announced that it will be attempting to launch 54 Starlink satellites on September 18. The launch has already witnessed five consecutive delays due to unfavourable weather. The first launch was attempted on September 13. The firm has launched 41 missions so far this year and plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

399.title: US Prez Biden to pay tribute to Queen Elizabeth II lying in state
399.article_body: US President Joe Biden is likely to pay tribute at the coffin of Queen Elizabeth II in London on Sunday. Biden will then join King Charles and other world leaders for a reception ahead of the grand state funeral scheduled for Monday. Hundreds of thousands of people have been queueing up to pay respects to the Queen lying in state.

400.title: Depriving public of benefits has become virtue for Cong: Union Minister
400.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said that not fulfilling people's expectations and depriving the public of benefits has become a virtue for Congress. While speaking at an event in Shimla's Rampur, Irani said, "They even did not complete the historic Atal Tunnel. This only highlights their inabilities. It was the BJP that completed the Atal Tunnel."
